page_number: 4
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Preface
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Target group of this manual
- type: TextItem
  text: '4'
- type: TextItem
  text: Preface
- type: TextItem
  text: This manual is intended for agrarians and others trained in working in the
    field of agriculture, people that are competent to operate these machine, as required
    by national legislation, and who have knowledge of assembly activities.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: For your safety
- type: TextItem
  text: Ensure that you are familiar with the contents of this manual before you start
    using or assembling the implement. This will ensure that you obtain an optimum
    result and are working safely.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Safety requirements« on page 10.
- type: ListItem
  text: Should you have any questions or if anything is unclear, please contact the
    manufacturer.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Make sure that this manual is available to all persons who will be working
    with this machine. In this way, you will:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · avoid accidents,
- type: ListItem
  text: · respect the warranty conditions,
- type: ListItem
  text: · always have a good functioning machine in perfect working order.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: For the employer
- type: ListItem
  text: · All personnel who operate this machine must be authorised to do so in terms
    of the applicable national legislation.
- type: ListItem
  text: ·  All personnel are to be trained in the use of the machine regularly (at
    least once a year) in accordance with employers' liability insurance association
    guidelines. Untrained or unauthorised individuals are not permitted to use the
    machinery.
- type: ListItem
  text: · You are responsible for the safe operation and maintenance of your machine.
    You must ensure that you and anyone else who is going to operate, maintain or
    work around the unit be familiar with the operating and maintenance procedures
    and related safety information as mentioned in this manual.
- type: ListItem
  text: '· You are responsible for providing personal protective gear to personnel
    who use the machine or who are performing maintenance or repairs on it. This includes:
    safety goggles, safety shoes, safety gloves, etc.'

page_number: 5
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Meaning of symbols
- type: TextItem
  text: Preface
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Various symbols are used to provide a clear understanding of the text.. These
    are explained below:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · A dot is placed before lists.
- type: ListItem
  text:  A triangle marks tasks you have to perform.
- type: ListItem
  text:  An arrow refers to a different place in the text.
- type: TextItem
  text: In addition, we use pictograms to help you easily find certain text sections.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION The words 'Tip' and 'Hint' are followed by tips or hints for operation.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The warning triangle indicates important safety instructions. Failing to
    comply with these may result in:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · serious operating malfunctions of the machine;
- type: ListItem
  text: · damage to the machine;
- type: ListItem
  text: · injuries or accidents.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spanner indicates tips for assembly or adjustment work.
- type: TextItem
  text: A star indicates that examples will follow that are intended to clarify the
    text.
- type: TextItem
  text: All directional rotations are to be interpreted when facing in direction of
    travel.
- type: TextItem
  text: '5'

page_number: 6
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: For your safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Other guidelines
- type: TextItem
  text: '6'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: In this chapter you will find general safety instructions. In every next chapter
    you will find more specific safety instructions not described here.
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not risk injury or death by ignoring good safety instructions.
- type: TextItem
  text: Many risks can happen when working with agricultural machines. Avoid accidents!
    Do not take risks! Be alert! Think safety! Work in safety!
- type: TextItem
  text: Disregard of the 'Safety instructions', inadequate maintenance, use of the
    machine other than for its intended purpose, overloading or unauthorised modification
    of the machine, renders the manufacturer's warranty and responsibility void.
- type: TextItem
  text: Familiarise yourself with the function of all machine controls and the safety
    instructions, prior to any usage of the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: Incorrect use of the machine may lead to dangerous situations. For this reason,
    you should always work carefully and never under high time pressure.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Comply with the rules
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In addition to the instructions above you should comply with the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · measures to prevent accidents,
- type: ListItem
  text: · general safety instructions, occupational health requirements and road traffic
    regulations,
- type: ListItem
  text: · instructions in this manual,
- type: ListItem
  text: · Rules regarding use, maintenance and repairs.

page_number: 7
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Warning stickers
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: TextItem
  text: Various warning stickers have been affixed to the machine for safety reasons.
    Do not remove them! Always follow the instructions supplied and be alert to possible
    dangers.
- type: TextItem
  text: Always keep the safety stickers and symbols clean and clearly legible. Replace
    safety decals that are missing, damaged or have become illegible. If original
    parts on which a safety decal or sign was installed are replaced, be sure that
    the replacement part also displays the current decal or sign.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '7'

page_number: 8
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Explanation for warning stickers
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '8'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Stop the engine and remove the keys from the ignition
- type: TextItem
  text: Switch the engine off as soon as you leave the tractor. Remove the key from
    the ignition to prevent the tractor from being started unintentionally while you
    are in the danger zone. This especially applies when changing the settings or
    while maintenance and repairs are carried out.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Keep clear from a running machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser is spread over a great distance during operation. Ensure that nobody
    comes within working reach of the machine during operation. Do not come into the
    working area before all parts of the machine are standing still.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The power lift must only be operated outside of the danger zone
- type: TextItem
  text: In the area between the tractor and the machine, there is a danger of being
    pinned down by the power lift. The power lift must therefore only be engaged from
    beyond the danger zone. Secure the tractor with the parking brake and wheel chocks
    to ensure it would not roll away.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not approach the machine until it has come to a complete standstill
- type: TextItem
  text: The rotating parts of the machine never come to an immediate halt, they always
    wind down. The moving parts of a machine are not always visible. Do not approach
    the machine until all moving parts have come to a complete halt.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never go underneath an elevated, unsecured machine
- type: TextItem
  text: The machine or parts of the machine could accidentally fall due to waning
    pressure, for instance. Always place the machine on proper supports if you have
    to work under the machine!

page_number: 9
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only lift the machine at the lifting points
- type: TextItem
  text: If a machine is being elevated, only attach it to the indicated lifting points.
    Never go underneath an elevated machine. Allow for any possible movements of the
    elevated machine, whether wanted or not.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful of getting jammed or pinched
- type: TextItem
  text: If the machine is engaged or operated unintentionally you could get struck
    in moving parts, which could lead to injury. Be extra alert when working in the
    vicinity of moving parts. Always keep in mind that the motor or parts of the machine
    could still be retaining some energy.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Read the user's manual
- type: TextItem
  text: The instruction manual contains procedures for working correctly to ensure
    safe work, as well as dangers one could possibly encounter. Keep to these procedures
    as described and give due consideration to the safety measures in place!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not exceed the maximum hydraulic pressure of 210 bars
- type: TextItem
  text: Prevent the pressure in the hydraulic system from exceeding 210 bars! Working
    with higher pressure may damage your machine and result in dangerous situations.
- type: TextItem
  text: Motor vehicles with limited speed (<40 km/h), agricultural and forestry tractors
    and their trailers, as well as other vehicles, must be provided with an orange
    triangle with a red reflector at the rear in the form of a truncated triangle.
- type: TextItem
  text: '9'

page_number: 10
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Safety requirements
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Intended use
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Person
- type: TextItem
  text: '10'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: This part contains all the requirements, everything that is not permitted
    and requirements for each form of usage, maintenance and reparation of the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: The chapters in the manual contain additional safety measures.
- type: TextItem
  text: Knowledge of the safety regulations forms the basis for safety and proper
    usage of the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: Always follow the safety instructions. most accidents are avoidable. Do not
    run the risk of serious or fatal accidents through ignorance of these safety instructions.
- type: TextItem
  text: This machine is exclusively intended to spread granular products, specifically
    fertiliser types and seeds.
- type: TextItem
  text: Any other application would be considered to be irregular. The manufacturer
    is not responsible for damage that may result from such usage; risks are taken
    exclusively by the user.
- type: TextItem
  text: The instructions, maintenance requirements and reparation stipulations as
    indicated by the manufacturer must be adhered to at all times.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Responsibility of the user
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The user may only operate the machine if he/she:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · is familiar with the basic safety requirements and the working conditions
    requirements,
- type: ListItem
  text: · is familiar with current traffic regulations,
- type: ListItem
  text: · has been duly instructed on how to work on/with the machine and the related
    dangers,
- type: ListItem
  text: · has read and understood this manual,
- type: ListItem
  text: · is familiar with all the systems and operating elements and their functions,
- type: ListItem
  text: · is familiar with the requirements for using, maintaining and repairing machines.
- type: TextItem
  text: It will be too late for that once you are working!
- type: TextItem
  text: Irresponsible usage could lead to injury to the user or third parties and
    could lead to damage to the machine.

page_number: 11
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Authorisation
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Clothes/protection
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only to be used by an authorised person
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The machine may be used by authorised people only. A person is authorised
    if he/she:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · received training as required by the national authorities,
- type: ListItem
  text: · has taken responsibility as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Person« on page 10.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Maintenance and repairs by experts
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance, replacement of parts and repairs to the machine may only be performed
    by experts.
- type: TextItem
  text: A person is considered to be an expert if he/she has sufficient knowledge
    in the fields of safety, maintenance, production and repairs as a result of training
    and experience.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance or repairs performed by an unskilled person could lead to injury
    and damage the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Wear close-fitting clothing
- type: TextItem
  text: Avoid wearing loose fitting clothing. Loose clothing could become entangled
    with moving parts, which could lead to serious consequences.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Ensure personal protection
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Ensure your personal protection. Outfit:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · safety goggles,
- type: ListItem
  text: · safety shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · safety gloves.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Prevent hearing damage
- type: TextItem
  text: Your hearing could be damaged when working with the tractor and machine with
    noise levels in excess of 80 dB. Use the appropriate ear protection in order to
    prevent hearing damage. Remaining in an area with high noise levels for a long
    period of time could lead to serious damage to your hearing.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: What to do in the event of injury
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In the event of injury and if you suspect that you made contact with materials
    you should:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · clean the point of contact with a lot of water,
- type: ListItem
  text: · contact your physician immediately!
- type: TextItem
  text: '11'

page_number: 12
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Workplace
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Tractor
- type: TextItem
  text: '12'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be used and operated by 1 person
- type: TextItem
  text: The machine may only be operated by one person, from the tractor. Operating
    the machine from the tractor will keep you out of harm's way. Other people should
    not be in the immediate vicinity of the machine and the tractor. Those who are
    within the working area and the danger zone could be injured.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity
- type: TextItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity and keep a constant eye on it at the start, as
    well as while you are working with the machine. Familiarise yourself with the
    immediate vicinity. Do not start working until all people and obstacles within
    the working area and danger zone of the tractor and machine have been removed.
- type: TextItem
  text: Never stay or allow anyone to stay within the danger area while the machine
    is running! If there are people within the working area and the danger zone it
    could lead to injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work with a closed cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser dust can blow indoors through open windows, doors or other openings.
    Moreover, the sound level is higher in an open cabin. It is therefore recommended
    to always work with a closed cabin with active carbon filters in the air inlets.
    Fertiliser dust and a high sound level can cause physical damage.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the state of the tractor and machine
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Only work with the tractor and machine if they are in good condition Always
    check that:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · all lighting, safety and warning provisions must be mounted correctly and
    be in good working condition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the lifting and pulling capabilities must be sufficient,
- type: ListItem
  text:  see paragraph »Calculate the axle load with tractor-mounted machines« on
    page 13,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the tractor must be suitable for the machine, such as in the area of stability,
    engine capability, axle load and total weight,
- type: ListItem
  text: · it is sufficient for the working with the machine and for transport.
- type: TextItem
  text: Adhere to maximum permissible axle loads, total weights and transport dimensions!
    Using a tractor which is not proper can cause serious or deadly injuries or machine
    damage.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the tractor's technical details.

page_number: 13
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Calculate the axle load with tractor-mounted machines
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Put a fire extinguisher in place
- type: TextItem
  text: Carry a fire extinguisher at all times, especially when operating in dry crop
    materials. This should be a multi-purpose ABC rated extinguisher with a 5 kg capacity,
    approved by the appropriate authority. Mount this on the tractor and/or on the
    machine. Fire could damage the machine and cause injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use active carbon filters
- type: TextItem
  text: Harmful gasses and mists could enter the air duct of the tractor while it
    is in use. An active carbon filter should therefore be mounted in the air ventilation
    of the tractor. Harmful materials could cause serious personal injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Ensure the tractor is safe when leaving it
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Never leave the tractor without:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the PTO shaft,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the tractor engine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the key must be removed from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: Leaving the tractor unsafe could create dangerous situations that could lead
    to injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Responding to problems
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In the event of operational problems you should:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · stop immediately,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor and machine off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · attend to the problem or call in the assistance of an expert.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never use the tractor in a closed area
- type: TextItem
  text: The tractor must never be used in a closed area. Exhaust fumes collect without
    being noticed. Exhaust fumes can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The following is of importance with the loading machine to ensure safe operation:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · the maximum load of the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the maximum axle load of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · weight distribution over the axles,
- type: ListItem
  text: · and the carry load per wheel.
- type: TextItem
  text: At least 20% own weight from the tractor must rest on the front axle and 45%
    on the rear axle in order to maintain good manoeuvrability. Check if these conditions
    are adhered to before purchasing a machine! Adhere to maximum permissible axle
    loads, total weights and transport dimensions! Using a tractor which is not proper
    can cause serious or deadly injuries or tractor and machine damage.
- type: TextItem
  text: '13'

page_number: 14
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Required details
- type: TextItem
  text: '14'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: The following details are necessary in order to calculate the minimum requirements
    and actual axle load, as well as the actual and maximum total weight. The details
    of the tractor should be given in the tractor manual. The details of the tyres
    should be supplied by the manufacturer. The details of the machine are in this
    manual.
- type: TextItem
  text:  in paragraph »Technical specifications« on page 36.

      1: The weight on the front axle of the tractor without the machine (1)
      2: The weight on the rear axle of the tractor without the machine (1)
      3: The total weight of the forward end hooked machine or weights
      4: The total weight of the rear-end hooked machine or weights
      5: The distance between the centre of gravity of the machine and  the middle
        point of the axle
      6: Wheel base of the tractor
      7: The distance between the centre of the rear axle and the centre  point of
        attachment of the lifting arm (3)
      8: The distance between the centre of gravity of the machine and  the middle
        of the point of attachment of the lifting arm (2)
      9: (1) Also include the weight of the accessories and the weight of the water
        in the tyres
      10: (2) If unknown, suppose i = half the machine length

page_number: 15
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: The calculations can be made with the values given in the above chart.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Actual total weight
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The actual total weight must not exceed the permitted total weight. The actual
    total weight (in kg) is calculated as follows:'
- type: TextItem
  text: Actual total weight (kg) = A + D + E
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Actual front axle load
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The actual front axle load must not exceed the permitted maximum load. The
    actual total front axle load (in kg) is calculated as follows:'
- type: TextItem
  text: g Actual front axle load = D x ( f + g ) + ( B x g ) - E x (h + i )
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Actual rear axle load
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The actual rear axle load must not exceed the permitted maximum load. The
    actual total rear axle load (in kg) is calculated as follows:'
- type: TextItem
  text: Actual rear axle load (kg) =
- type: TextItem
  text: actual total weight (kg) -
- type: TextItem
  text: actual front axle load (kg)
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Ballast required in the front
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The minimum load on the front axle must be 20% of the basic weight of the
    tractor. With a mounted machine in the power lift behind the tractor the minimum
    required ballast (in kg) in front of the tractor is calculated as follows:'
- type: TextItem
  text: f + g Front ballast required (kg) = E x ( h + i ) - ( B x g ) + (0.2 x A x
    g )
- type: TextItem
  text: If the calculated value is negative no additional ballast is required.
- type: TextItem
  text: '15'

    (in kg) in the power lift behind the tractor is calculated as follows:'
- type: TextItem

page_number: 17
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety decals
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the condition of the machine before use
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Check the following before using the machine:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the machine in a proper, functioning condition?
- type: ListItem
  text: · are all lights, safety and warning provisions correctly mounted and in good
    working condition?
- type: ListItem
  text: · are the brakes of the machine working properly and have they been adjusted
    to the correct position?
- type: TextItem
  text: Using an unsafe machine could result in personal injury and damage to the
    machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The machine should only carry, not pull!
- type: TextItem
  text: It is not permitted to use the machine for pulling as this would have detrimental
    consequences to its construction. This could lead to dangerous situations for
    bystanders, unsafe operation or damage to crops.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not stand on the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Being on the machine during activities and transport is prohibited. You may
    only be on the parts of the machine intended for the purpose if it is standing
    still and prevented from rolling by means of parking brake and wheel chocks. Being
    on the machine while in any other state could lead to serious injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never work on a running machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Never work on the machine while it is running. A running machine has several
    moving parts which can not be seen. Wait until all parts have come to a complete
    halt. Moving parts can cause serious injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Follow the instructions on the stickers
- type: TextItem
  text: The safety decals on the machine give important advice for a risk free operation.
    Respect them to ensure your safety.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Replace any safety decals and safety signs missing or illegible
- type: TextItem
  text: When parts with a safety or warning decal are replaced, the replacement part
    must be provided with the same safety or warning decal. Stickers that are not
    legible must be replaced so that they would be clearly legible at all times.
- type: TextItem
  text: '17'
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''

page_number: 18
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Coupling shaft
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Hydraulic system
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Electronic control system
- type: TextItem
  text: '18'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use the correct coupling shaft
- type: TextItem
  text: Only use coupling shafts complying with the manufacturer's specification for
    that specific use! In order to ensure protection of both man and machine exercise
    extreme caution when working at a coupling shaft other then described in this
    manual and/or on the instruction at the coupling shaft.
- type: TextItem
  text: Modifications to and other special activities at coupling shafts are only
    permitted with the explicit written instruction and approval of the manufacturers
    of both the machine and the coupling shaft! Use the correct tools and original
    parts to ensure a good performance and maximum safety. The use of an incorrect
    coupling shaft can cause damage to the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Mount the appropriate protection
- type: TextItem
  text: Externally accessible coupling shafts, the tractor's PTO shafts and machine
    input-axle must be equipped with appropriate guards and tubes. Working without
    guarding can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Replace protective coupling shaft tubes when required
- type: TextItem
  text: Replace the coupling shaft protection sleeves at the first signs of wear.
    Protection sleeves can wear without being noticed. Worn or damaged protection
    sleeves can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Protect the PTO shaft end well
- type: TextItem
  text: Slide the protection sleeve over the PTO shaft as soon as the coupling shaft
    has been removed. Clothing could become entangled into an unprotected PTO shaft
    end that could lead to serious injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Hydraulic oil is under high pressure
- type: TextItem
  text: Never try to stop a leak with your fingers. Never try to locate a hydraulic
    leak or try to contain it by hand! When inspecting always use appropriate aid
    (e.g. a piece of wood or sheet metal) and wear safety goggles, safety gloves and
    gloves! High pressure fluid easily penetrates skin and clothes, causing severe
    injuries. In the event of injury, contact your physician immediately!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Disconnect the control box
- type: TextItem
  text: Disconnect the control box from the electric system as soon as no more functions
    are needed in order to prevent unintentional operation. Keeping the control box
    connect can be dangerous and can damage the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: as well as cause bodily injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Battery cables must be connected properly
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Always disconnect the battery cable (negative pole) from the electric system
    when working on the machine. Connect the battery cables correctly: Positive pole
    first, followed by the negative pole. Always equip the positive pole with the
    appropriate protective cap to avoid a short circuit as this could lead to damage
    to the tractor and machine.'

page_number: 19
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Use
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only use after training
- type: TextItem
  text: The machine may not be operated before the user has been properly instructed
    by the dealer or an authorised representative of the manufacturer.
- type: TextItem
  text: Ensure that you are familiar with all systems and control machines and their
    functions prior to working with them! It will be too late for that once you are
    working! Careless usage could lead to injury and damage to the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be used and operated by 1 person
- type: TextItem
  text: The machine may only be operated by one person, from the tractor. Operating
    the machine from the tractor will keep you out of harm's way. Other people should
    not be in the immediate vicinity of the machine and the tractor. Those who are
    within the working area and the danger zone could be injured.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity
- type: TextItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity and keep a constant eye on it at the start, as
    well as while you are working with the machine. Familiarise yourself with the
    immediate vicinity. Do not start working until all people and obstacles within
    the working area and danger zone of the tractor and machine have been removed.
- type: TextItem
  text: Never stay or allow anyone to stay within the danger area while the machine
    is running! If there are people within the working area and the danger zone it
    could lead to injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not stand on the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Being on the machine during activities and transport is prohibited. You may
    only be on the parts of the machine intended for the purpose if it is standing
    still and prevented from rolling. Being on the machine while in any other state
    could lead to serious injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Keep the protection intact
- type: TextItem
  text: The protection of the machine, e.g. shields and guards, protects from penetrating
    into danger areas! Therefore all protection must be kept in optimal condition
    and moved into the right position prior to starting to work! The absence of protective
    gear could lead to injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: '19'

page_number: 20
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Transport
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: On the field
- type: TextItem
  text: '20'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the decoupling ropes of the quick coupling
- type: TextItem
  text: The decoupling ropes must never be tense and must provide sufficient freedom
    for movement, even with the power lift in the lowest position as it could otherwise
    accidentally disconnect the quick coupling.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Drive carefully
- type: TextItem
  text: Moving behaviour, manoeuvrability and braking performance are influenced by
    a trailed machine. When taking turns, pay attention to the extended width/length
    (turning circle) and/or large mass (sluggishness) of the machine. Ensure sufficient
    braking effect and safe manageability! Careless driving could lead to serious
    injury and damage to the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adjust the driving speed
- type: TextItem
  text: High driving speeds and uneven surfaces on the road or field can put considerable
    strain on the machine and cause the tractor or machine to be overstrained, which
    could lead to damage. Always adjust the driving speed to the conditions of the
    environment and the terrain! When driving up and down hills and across slopes,
    do not make any sudden turns!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not leave the driving cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: Never leave the operator's seat during operation or transport. The driver
    can be in the danger zone of the tractor or the machine and could not have a proper
    view of the immediate vicinity. This could lead to injury to the driver or third
    parties.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not allow the machine to tilt
- type: TextItem
  text: When driving up and down hills and across slopes, do not make any sudden turns!
    Do not drive transverse on a slope with a steep angle. Tilting can cause serious
    machine damage.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Blockade of a security device
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In case of blockade or operation of a security device, never work on the
    machine without:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the PTO shaft,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the tractor engine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the key must be removed from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: PTO shaft rotates after disengaging
- type: TextItem
  text: After switching off the PTO shaft, the machine will continue running because
    of inertia. Keep a safe distance to the machine until the moving parts have come
    to a complete stop. Approaching the machine while it is rotating can cause serious
    or deadly injuries.

page_number: 21
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Always keep to the prescribed maintenance intervals
- type: TextItem
  text: Take the machine for inspection and maintenance at the intervals as prescribed
    in this manual. All of the manufacturer's responsibility and the guarantee will
    become null and void if the prescribed intervals are not adhered to.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Performed by an authorised person
- type: TextItem
  text: Always have an authorised expert perform maintenance and repairs as prescribed
    in, as prescribed in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Authorisation« on page 11.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance performed in an inexpert manner could lead to unsafe work situations
    or damage to the machine or crops.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never use the tractor in a closed area
- type: TextItem
  text: The tractor must never be used in a closed area. Exhaust fumes collect without
    being noticed. Exhaust fumes can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Protect the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser and other salts have a great influence on the rate of corrosion.
    Empty the hopper at the end of activities. Protect the machine by always cleaning
    it after using such material and patch breaks in the paint. Corrosion affects
    the strength of the construction and the operation of the machine, which could
    lead to a shortened lifespan.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only use original parts when replacing
- type: TextItem
  text: Using other non-genuine parts could lead to problems and unsafe situations
    when using the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can use the supplied parts manual (either as a printout or as a PDF in
    the included memory card) to locate the correct part number.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never work on the machine while it is running
- type: TextItem
  text: Never work on the machine while it is running. A running machine has several
    moving parts which can not be seen. These can cause serious injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not change the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not modify the machine in any way. Unauthorised modifications may impair
    the function and/or safety and affect the life of the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: '21'

page_number: 22
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Safety
- type: TextItem
  text: '22'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with materials
- type: TextItem
  text: You should only come into contact with the materials when cleaning the machine.
    Always wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves, shoes and goggles. Read
    and adhere to the additional safety instructions and the of the material producer.
    Contact with the materials could lead to injury. Contact your physician in such
    an event!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Explosion danger because of nitrate
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertilisers hat contain nitrate can create an explosion danger if they come
    into contact with fire. All fertiliser remnants should therefore be removed from
    voids, corners, tubes and tubing before welding, cutting or grinding on the machine.
    Explosions could cause damage to the machine and lead to personal injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Prevent unintentional operation
- type: TextItem
  text: Render all parts that could contain residual energy safe, as well as all parts
    that conduct energy such as compressed air, hydraulics and electricity. Release
    all pressure from the system and disconnect the pipes and cables. Unintended operation
    could lead to injury.

page_number: 23
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Applications of the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: This PTO shaft driven machine is suited for spreading granular fertiliser
    on the field and grazing land. It is attached
- type: TextItem
  text: Connection to a gusset in the headland
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Connection to a gusset in the headland
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Software
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Software
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: CentreFlow spreading system
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text: · to the three-point power lift of the tractor (Cat. II),
- type: ListItem
  text: · with linkage frame (optional extras) for tractors with power lift of Cat.
    III, or
- type: ListItem
  text: · to the trailer supplied for this purpose.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Border spreading is possible by using the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Hydraulic border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text: · the ExactLine border spreading system.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: GEOSPREAD with GEOCONTROL
- type: TextItem
  text: With the GEOCONTROL software, connection of
- type: ListItem
  text: · the passes on the headland,
- type: ListItem
  text: · sloping passes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · and last incomplete pass improved.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Gored spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: Even a headland connecting at a slant (angle) is correctly connected in the
    pass by the variable width distribution of the GEOSPREAD.
- type: TextItem
  text: This manual contains a description for the GEOSPREAD control system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: This manual contains a description for the GEOSPREAD control system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  For a detailed description see the instruction manual of the software.
- type: TextItem
  text: This rotary type spreader has two spreading discs. Each has eight by a dosing
    plate on top of the spreading disc. Both of the dosing
- type: TextItem
  text: vanes. They are mounted level so that the fertiliser is spread over the land
    in a constant horizontal flow. The spreading quantity is regulated plates are
    located right on top of the discharge bushings. The fertiliser falls on the turning
    spreading disc. The discharge point is determined by the opening in the discharge
    bushing behind the vanes. This means that the fertiliser granules are already
    turning before they come into contact with the vanes on the spreading disc. This
    prevents granules from breaking apart and becoming powdery. The agitator mounted
    below in the hopper provides for a constant stream of fertiliser dust, seeds or
    granules to the dosing opening(s). Moreover, the agitator prevents the chunks
    of fertiliser from blocking
- type: TextItem
  text: one or more dosing openings.
- type: TextItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: '23'

page_number: 24
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adjust carefully
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Application rate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Fine dosing
- type: TextItem
  text: Fine application handle Normal dosing setting
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Fine application handle Normal dosing setting
- type: TextItem
  text: Fine application handle Fine application setting
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Fine application handle Fine application setting
- type: TextItem
  text: '24'
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreader has two actuators per dosing unit to set the application rate
    and working width independently of each other. Moreover, it is possible to shut
    2 of the 3 dosing openings so that the application rate can also be set precisely
    with a low flowrate, while the risk of blockages remains limited.
- type: TextItem
  text: The machine is equipped with two actuators, which service a dosing plate each,
    in order to set the application rate. This actuator can open the dosing plate
    in every required position. In this way, accurate dosing independent of the driving
    speed is possible. It is also possible to control the dosing setting with external
    sensors, for example, a nitrogen sensor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Application rate« on page 66.
- type: TextItem
  text: The actuators are controlled by means of the spreader software. By means of
    weight sensors, the spreader continuously measures the discharge volumes and corrects
    it as needed with the application rate. If you want to close on one side, you
    can choose the function on the control box, after which one of the two dosing
    plates will be closed immediately.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Normal dosing
- type: TextItem
  text: For precise dosing over a wide range of settings, a spreader with 3 openings
    is applied per disc.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Fine application
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreader is equipped with a fine spreader as standard equipment to spread
    low application rates. This fine spreader can be adjusted with a lever per dosing
    unit.
- type: TextItem
  text: Low application rates require a small dosing opening. In order
- type: ListItem
  text: · to finely adjust the settings
- type: ListItem
  text: · and to counter the blockage
- type: TextItem
  text: a transition to the opening, which is open wider, is desirable.
- type: TextItem
  text: 2 of the 3 dosing openings are closed when using the fine dosing setting.
- type: TextItem
  text: The fertiliser now flows through one opening that is opened wider, giving
    an accurate, reliable flow, also at low application rate.

page_number: 25
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Width distribution with GEOSPREAD
- type: TextItem
  text: Actuator for discharge point adjustment
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Actuator for discharge point adjustment
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Combined control with GEOSPREAD system
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Discharge point letter setting
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The spreading pattern is determined by the transverse distribution.
- type: TextItem
  text: The discharge point is the place where the fertiliser granules come into touch
    with the vanes of the spreading disc and substantially determines width distribution.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Actuators for setting the discharge point
- type: TextItem
  text: The GEOSPREAD execution has two additional actuators which set the discharge
    point. The discharge point setting depends on the fertiliser type and the flowrate
    in kg/min.
- type: TextItem
  text: The letter setting for the discharge point for the working width and application
    rate is given in the spreading chart. The spreading computer determines the correct
    setting with the input working and spreading chart data.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading pattern form
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreading pattern is normally a triangle that completely overlaps. A trapezoidal
    spreading pattern may result, depending on the type of fertiliser, working width
    and application rate. This spreading pattern has an overlapping area of less than
    100%.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Reducing working width during the pass
- type: TextItem
  text: The control of discharge point and dosing via the 4 actuators enables the
    calculation of a variable working width. By means of this, the working width can
    be varied at an angle on the headlands (gored spreading) or an incomplete final
    pass without interrupting the spreading for this purpose.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spray computer can determine the time of full or partial closure with
    the GPS and the data of the sprayed passes. This takes place on the headland and
    during gored spreading. The quantity of over or under fertilisation is substantially
    reduced by this.
- type: TextItem
  text: '25'

page_number: 26
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Display of the sections in the main screen
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Shown in the GEOCONTROL screen
- type: TextItem
  text: Active sections
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Active sections
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The active sections are displayed in black triangles in the main screen for
    both sides:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · The working width of 24 metres is divided into sections and controlled by
    the GEOCONTROL.
- type: TextItem
  text: The working width reduction per section is displayed in the main screen by
    leaving out a part of the triangle at a time and displaying the new working width.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Here, sections to the left are closed.
- type: TextItem
  text: The GEOCONTROL screen also displays the section of activities in a bar below
    the screen.
- type: TextItem
  text: Check the accuracy of the discharge point letter setting by conducting a spreading
    pattern test (tray test).
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Spreading pattern check (tray test)« on page 76.
- type: TextItem
  text: Take note of the exact driving distance and make sure there are tramlines.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you want to change the application rate or change to another fertiliser
    type (with similar working width and driving speed), you only have to enter a
    new flowrate starting value and relevant dosing setting and adapt the discharge
    point letter setting, if required.
- type: TextItem
  text: '26'

page_number: 27
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: RATE control
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: MULTIRATE
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Greenseeker
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: RATE control is a variable application rate triggered by an external signal.
- type: TextItem
  text: No additional licence key is required.
- type: TextItem
  text: .
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the GEOCONTROL instruction manual
- type: TextItem
  text: MULTIRATE can be used on your ISOBUS weighing spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: An additional licence key is required to enable the software module.
- type: TextItem
  text: MULTIRATE automatically adjusts the amount of fertiliser per side. The application
    rate to the left and right is independently based on a rate map.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can do this on the basis of a maximum of 8 measuring points of the rate
    map.
- type: TextItem
  text: This is a combined functionality between the spreader and the terminal, providing
    the option of using two or more variable quantities in the working width of the
    spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: A total of 8 VRA sections are supported by the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: To achieve full functionality with the IsoMatch PRO Terminal, you also need
    the IsoMatch GEOCONTROL licence key.
- type: TextItem
  text: When MULTIRATE signals are received, the following icon is visible.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the GEOCONTROL instruction manual
- type: TextItem
  text: The ISOBUS supports the Farmfacts Greeseeker sensor. From Greenseeker version
    06.00.00.0257 onwards, the software supports the reception of the external signal.
    Section control continues working through the Task Controller.
- type: TextItem
  text: '27'

page_number: 28
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading pattern
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Full field spreading pattern
- type: TextItem
  text: Optimum distribution of the fertiliser with minimum impact on the environment
    can be achieved through the settings and tools described.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The full field spreading pattern overlaps 100%
- type: TextItem
  text: A triangular spreading pattern that completely overlaps can be expected with
    most fertiliser types with an average working width.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Influence of the GEOSPREAD function
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: One-sided boundary spreading with border spreading plate
- type: TextItem
  text: You can drive along the field edge with a half spreading pattern filled to
    100% with the border spreading plate and one closed dosing unit. You have to optimise
    the spreading pattern and thereby overcome environmental pollution when adjusting
    the border spreading plate.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: With the hydraulic border spreading plate, one-sided boundary spreading is
    also possible at the left.
- type: TextItem
  text: '28'
- type: TextItem
  text: A trapezium-shaped spreading pattern will gradually be converted to a triangular
    spreading pattern with complete overlap by reducing the working width on sloping
    passes.

page_number: 29
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Boundary track spreading with ExactLine
- type: TextItem
  text: It is possible to spread right up to the border (boundary track spreading)
    from the first sprayer tramline with ExactLine.
- type: TextItem
  text: A ExactLine is available for the right and the left.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Selecting the pattern for border spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: It is not possible to completely cover the field border at the application
    rate and not have anything go beyond the border. Current environmental standards
    only allow for minimal loss over the field edge.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: ExactLine
- type: TextItem
  text: ExactLine bends the fertiliser granules in such a way that loss over the edge
    of the border is restricted to the bare minimum and it provides as full a spreading
    pattern as possible.
- type: TextItem
  text: ExactLine has 'environment' and 'yield' settings for precisely adjusting border
    spreading.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '29'

page_number: 30
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The ISO control system
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The automatic weighing system
- type: TextItem
  text: The ISO control system uses the ISOBUS communication protocol, which makes
    it suitable for tractors that are also equipped with an ISOBUS communication system.
    For tractors that still do not have an ISOBUS connection, your dealer can supply
    the universal IsoMatch terminal to which you can connect all ISOBUS machines.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreader uses weighcells to continuously measure the quantity of fertiliser
    that is being spread. The computer in the distribution box compares these values
    with the set application rate and corrects as needed by further opening or closing
    the dosing unit. The tractor's electronics or an extra (gps) sensor measures the
    current required driving speed and localisation.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: The working width and the start/stop time is controlled with field boundaries
    and headlands. Field data imported from a new management system or a newly created
    field boundary is used for this purpose.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '30'

page_number: 31
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: flowrate (kg/min)
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Dosing setting
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The computer calculates the required fertiliser flowrate with the following
    formula:'
- type: TextItem
  text: Flowrate required = (kg/min)
- type: TextItem
  text: Working width (m) x Driving speed (km/h) x Application rate (kg/ha)
- type: TextItem
  text: '600'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Automatic Calibration test
- type: TextItem
  text: With the data from the spreading chart book and the automatic calibration
    tests that the spreader carries out every 75 kg or every minute, the computer
    determines what dosing setting corresponds with what flowrate. This relation is
    different for each fertiliser type, after all. A shorter interim time can be set
    for shorter fields.
- type: TextItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use spreading chart
- type: TextItem
  text: To determine the relation between dosing setting and flowrate, the computer
    needs at least 1 measuring point. This value comes from the spreading chart. By
    means of the automatic calibration tests, the computer repeatedly corrects the
    relation between flowrate and dosing setting. In this way, the relation is always
    current and the spreader reacts in the right way to changes, for example, in driving
    speed or in cases of over and under dosing.
- type: TextItem
  text: To prevent field conditions such as slopes and holes or steering, braking
    actions and vibrations from influencing the measured values, the machine is equipped
    with a reference sensor. By means of the reference sensor signal, the spreader
    corrects the influence of the factors mentioned.
- type: ListItem
  text: If the hopper content becomes less than 100 kg, the control system switches
    off the automatic calibration. Measurement accuracy declines in such a way that
    new automatic calibration cannot produce a better discharge curve.
- type: TextItem
  text: '31'

page_number: 32
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The ISO tractor
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Tractor with IsoMatch
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Conversion to ISO tractor with IsoMatch power cable set
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '32'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: ISOBUS tractor connection
- type: TextItem
  text: The switching functions and data transfer between the tractor terminal or
    ISO control box and the machine are operated via the ISOBUS. Specifically tilling
    the site and reacting to deviating field forms or soil compositions is possible
    through ISOBUS communication. With GPS, various sensors and management systems
    are provided with the necessary information in order to control the machine optimally.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: ISOBUS functionality via IsoMatch
- type: TextItem
  text: Tractors without their own ISO terminal can work as ISO tractors with the
    IsoMatch control box.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Driving speed, RPM and GPS signal on IsoMatch
- type: TextItem
  text: If speed is not measured on the (trailed) machine, but via the tractor, the
    speed sensor or the adapter cable is to be connected to the IsoMatch to capture
    the speed signal from the tractor electronics. A special cable set is required
    for this.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Directly to the ISO 11786 in cab tractor connection in the
    tractor cabin« on page 144.
- type: TextItem
  text: The same applies for the PTO shaft RPM. The extra sensor is available for
    this purpose.
- type: TextItem
  text: The GPS signal can also be used via the RS 232 on the control box. This is
    required for the GEOCONTROL functionality.
- type: TextItem
  text:  Also, refer to the manual that comes with your control box.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adapting non-ISO tractors with IsoMatch power cable set
- type: TextItem
  text: If the tractor does not have an ISOBUS communication, it can be added with
    the IsoMatch power cable set.
- type: TextItem
  text: Hereafter, your tractor is entirely ISOBUS ready, and you can connect and
    operate the machine with the IsoMatch control box.
- type: TextItem
  text: The driving speed of your tractor (or your trailed machine) is transmitted
    via the ISOBUS to the IsoMatch.
- type: TextItem
  text: The "IM Tellus Input" cable, supplied as a standard item, can be used for
    other connections.

page_number: 33
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The control box
- type: TextItem
  text: The working method and work performance of the IsoMatch control box are described
    in this user's manual.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch universal ISOBUS terminal
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Many functions and programmes on one control box
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The divided colour screen has a flexible division to:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Operate 2 programmes or functions simultaneously on screen, e.g. the main
    screen of your machine and a separate operating program. This can be done without
    having to switch.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Operate all keys directly on the touch screen.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text: · Instruction booklet of the terminal in the correct language on screen.
- type: ListItem
  text: '· Check the following by camera in the cabin while working:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · a specific point on the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the crop,
- type: ListItem
  text: · or the vicinity.
- type: TextItem
  text: '33'

page_number: 34
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: '· Extra functions:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Calculator
- type: ListItem
  text: · Internet browser
- type: ListItem
  text: · Camera screen (Camera is optional)
- type: ListItem
  text: · Status bar for time, GPS signal strength and driving direction
- type: ListItem
  text: '· Save and read:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Documents.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Tractor data.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Field data.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Work particulars of various ISO machines.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Client particulars.
- type: TextItem
  text: With the main switch on the upper left in the red extension, you can switch
    the control box on and off.
- type: TextItem
  text: Press the button for at least 1 sec.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Always switch off the control box when you leave the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the box is engaged, unintended functions can be activated while you are
    in the danger area. Moreover, the control box uses power, as a result of which
    the tractor battery could be flattened.
- type: TextItem
  text: After starting up, the screen with the last (two) selected applications appears.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Compact and complete
- type: TextItem
  text: IsoMatch Go, as a handy and more compact variant of the doublescreen version,
    offers complete ISO control with all functions. Besides the smaller dimension
    with the single screen, the number of USB connections and the absence of Wlan/Wifi
    constitutes the biggest difference.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Many additional functions.
- type: TextItem
  text: The latest developments in ISOBUS communication between tractor and implement
    and ease-of-use are all incorporated into the IsoMatch Tellus GO.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Connect the ISOBUS tractor via IM Tellus 9-point in Cab cable
- type: TextItem
  text: If your tractor is provided with a full ISOBUS connection, a connection with
    the 9-pins in Cab cable between your tractor and the IsoMatch Tellus GO control
    box is sufficient.
- type: TextItem
  text: Other connections are made via the "Input IM Tellus" cable, supplied as a
    standard item.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Quick menu navigation with the scroll wheel and additional keys
- type: TextItem
  text: A scroll wheel on the upper right of the box makes it easy to scroll
- type: TextItem
  text: through the menu.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch Tellus
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Scroll-wheel navigation
- type: TextItem
  text: '34'

page_number: 35
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch Grip
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Getting familiar with the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: The IsoMatch Grip accessory is a control unit on which most of the implement
    functions used can be operated centrally with one handle. This is available in
    addition to the ISOBUS terminal such as the IsoMatch.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Handle control
- type: TextItem
  text: While working attention and visibility is often required to follow the work
    process. By locating the control buttons on the handle by touch, it will enable
    you to keep your eyes on the driving system control and remain focussed while
    driving.
- type: TextItem
  text: If operating buttons can be located by the sense of touch reaction speed can
    be increased and operating mistakes avoided.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 44 functions under 11 buttons
- type: TextItem
  text: The IsoMatch Grip has 11 function buttons and one selector that are operated
    with the thumb and under which there are 44 functions.
- type: TextItem
  text: '35'

page_number: 38
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Before first use
- type: TextItem
  text: Before first use
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Inspection of the supplied machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Mounting instructions
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '38'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The machine would generally be assembled and delivered ready-foruse by the
    dealer. The dealer is also responsible for providing instructions for use and
    maintenance. He/she must also ensure that the required documents are provided,
    such as:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · manual,
- type: ListItem
  text: · spare parts manual
- type: ListItem
  text: · spreading chart book,
- type: ListItem
  text: · testing and approval documents where required.
- type: TextItem
  text: If parts are missing or have been damaged during transport, you should report
    that to your dealer directly on delivery.
- type: TextItem
  text: Before the machine can be used, various parts and supplied accessories must
    be unpacked and assembled.
- type: TextItem
  text: TIP In addition to the assembly instructions, use the parts book to locate
    the parts and their positions on the machine.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use sturdy hoisting equipment
- type: TextItem
  text: Use the hoisting points on the machine to hook up your approved slings or
    hoisting chains. If the machine is hoisted incorrectly or with inferior equipment
    it could fall from the sling, resulting in material damage and possible physical
    injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work on a clean surface
- type: TextItem
  text: Before you start mounting, you should clean the surface and the directly surrounding
    area where you place the machine. A machine that is placed on pieces of packaging
    or parts, may slide away during mounting with material damage and possibly physical
    injury as a result.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Accessories and parts must be correctly mounted
- type: TextItem
  text: Assemble accessories and parts according to specifications and attach them
    only for their designated purpose; ensure that it is locked correctly. Accessories
    and parts which are not fastened securely could lead to personal injury and damage
    to the crop and machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Tighten all bolts and nuts
- type: TextItem
  text: Check that all the nuts and bolts are well set. Check this again after one
    hour of use
- type: ListItem
  text: · after delivery and
- type: ListItem
  text: · after maintenance or repairs have been carried out.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never check holes to be lined up by inserting your fingers
- type: TextItem
  text: Use a pin. Movement of the machine or parts may cause severe physical injury.

page_number: 39
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Control box
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Before first use
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: 'It is easy for parts to get jammed while mounting the spreader. Work carefully:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · place the machine on adequate supports,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the PTO shaft,
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · Switch off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury!
- type: TextItem
  text: In addition to these assembly instructions, use the parts book to locate the
    parts and their positions on the machine or the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you use the IsoMatch or another loose-standing control box to operate the
    spreader, you must first assemble the support.
- type: TextItem
  text: The fixing materials and the assembly instructions are delivered with the
    control box. Additionally, you will find brief assembly instructions below.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you use the IsoMatch or another loose-standing ISO-control box with a tractor
    equipped with the ISOBUS communication system, you can connect it with the supplied
    7 points CAN cable to a standard tractor CAN connection.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the side of the cable to which 1 plug is attached to the tractor
    CAN connection.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the side of the cable to which 2 plugs are attached to both control
    box connections.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you use the IsoMatch or another loose-standing ISO-control box with a tractor
    that is not equipped with the ISOBUS communication system, you need a tractor
    ECU. Your dealer can supply this. This tractor ECU has an outgoing 9 point CAN
    plug.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the CAN-plug to the control box.
- type: TextItem
  text: '39'

page_number: 40
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Before first use
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Console assembly
- type: TextItem
  text: Console for the control box
- type: TextItem
  text: Console on mounting level
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Console on mounting level
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '40'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Mount the control box in a place where it would:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · be well visible,
- type: ListItem
  text: · easy to operate while spreading,
- type: ListItem
  text: · and result in minimal visual hindrance while driving the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: The console has two range and height adjustments to provide optimal view of
    the control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount the console to the back of the control box with the accompanying fixing
    materials.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount the pipe for console foot to a firm base.
- type: TextItem
  text: If there is no suitable place in the cabin a footplate should be made to which
    the pipe can be welded.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Weld a footplate to the pipe for it to be assembled on the selected level
    in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Ensure that there is sufficient free room behind the assembly level for
    drilling and assembly activities.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drill a hole pattern in the footplate and on the assembly level in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount the foot of the console.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the control box on the base of the pipe.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Bundle excessive feeder cable together with cable ties.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Also refer to the manual that comes with your control box.

page_number: 41
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch terminal on an ISO tractor
- type: TextItem
  text: If you use the IsoMatch control box with a tractor manufactured with the ISOBUS
    communication system, you can connect it with the supplied CAN cable to a standard
    tractor CAN connection.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the side of the cable to which 1 plug is attached to the tractor
    CAN connection.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the side of the cable to which 2 plugs are attached to control box
    connections.
- type: TextItem
  text: IsoMatch terminal on a NONISO tractor If you use the IsoMatch control box
    with a tractor that is not equipped with the ISOBUS communication system, an extra
    cable set is needed. This cable set is included in the order or can be supplied
    via
- type: TextItem
  text: your dealer.
- type: TextItem
  text: With the non-ISO adaptor cable set, you can equip any tractor type with a
    full ISOBUS communication system.
- type: TextItem
  text: The fixing materials and the assembly instructions are delivered with the
    IsoMatch control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See also paragraph »IsoMatch universal ISOBUS terminal« on page 33 and the
    description on page 142.
- type: ListItem

- type: TextItem

    system on the tractor. If you mount a separate GPS receiver on the tractor, you
    should connect the plug to the rear on the control box. Then switch on the appropriate
    external signal as described in
- type: TextItem
  text: The instruction manual of the software.

- type: ListItem

- type: ListItem
  text: · tractor,
- type: ListItem

- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only park with an empty hopper
- type: TextItem
  text: Only park the machine on the parking wheels if the hopper is empty! Parking
    with a filled hopper results in reduced stability. Moreover, the wheels are not
    designed for heavy loads. Damages to the machine and physical injury can be caused.
- type: TextItem
  text: A disconnected machine can easily be moved with the parking wheels.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Raise the machine to working height.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Secure the machine by placing adequate supports.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount the frame on the machine as described in the spare parts manual.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Secure the wheels with the lock clips.
- type: TextItem
  text: Caster wheels may be placed on the side of the frame. This prevents the crop
    from being damaged while spreading.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreader is provided with 12 vanes of equal length and 4 shorter.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Grease the threaded rods of the vanes.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Hook the short vanes into the correct position (see illustration).
- type: ListItem
  text:  Then place the other two vanes into the other positions.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Press the vanes in well and put the lock nut in position.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the vanes on the other side in the same manner.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fasten the lock nuts (50NM)
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Even wear of the vanes
- type: TextItem
  text: The long vanes are positioned in groups of three.
- type: TextItem
  text: The first vane considered in the direction of rotation of the disc will wear
    out most quickly.
- type: ListItem
  text: TIP  Exchange the first vane after the fixed vane, and the short vane, over
    a period of time.
- type: ListItem
  text:  After a subsequent period, exchange the foremost vane at that time with
    the central vane.
- type: TextItem
  text: As a result, the vanes will wear evenly and the spreading pattern will remain
    optimal.
- type: TextItem
  text: '43'

page_number: 48
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Before first use
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Calibration container
- type: TextItem
  text: support for the calibration container
- type: PictureItem
  caption: support for the calibration container
- type: TextItem
  text: The calibration container is used to control the dosing setting of the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: The calibration container must be mounted on the left spreading disc for the
    calibration test.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the vanes.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the nuts on the bolts on which the gearbox is mounted to the turning
    rod back 5 mm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Push the bolts back as far as possible.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Hook the support behind the heads of the bolts.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Adjust the height of the support. The top end of the support must be on
    the sae height as the top end of the turning rod.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fasten the nuts on the bolts again.
- type: TextItem
  text: NOTE Mount the support carefully so that the position of the gearbox would
    not be changed!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the calibration container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fix the locks between the two halves.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the other spreading disc by hand and listen if the spreading disc in
    the calibration container is making contact with the container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the lock nut upwards.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the settings knob upwards or downwards until you can hear that the
    spreading disc is no longer touching the calibration container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the lock nut again.
- type: TextItem
  text: S Settings knob
- type: PictureItem
  caption: S Settings knob
- type: TextItem
  text: Lock nut
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Lock nut
- type: TextItem
