page_number: 71
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Manual calibration test
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: support for the calibration container
- type: PictureItem
  caption: support for the calibration container
- type: TextItem
  text: support for the calibration
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: S
- type: TextItem
  text: Lock nut
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Lock nut
- type: TextItem
  text: NOTE
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not empty the calibration container!
- type: TextItem
  text: Rinsing the calibration container greatly improves the accuracy the calibration
    test. All parts of the calibration container where fertiliser, seeds or granules
    could remain would now be filled.
- type: TextItem
  text: The calibration test can now start.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Please refer to the software instruction manual for the procedure.
- type: TextItem
  text: '71'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: PTO shaft rotates after disengaging
- type: TextItem
  text: After switching off the PTO shaft, danger could arise as the machine will
    continue running because of inertia. Keep a safe distance to the machine until
    the moving parts have come to a complete stop. Approaching the machine while it
    is rotating can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can check with a manual calibration test if the preset dosing setting
    reaches the selected flowrate.
- type: TextItem
  text: The calibration test is normally performed on the left spreading disc. Perform
    the calibration test with a filled hopper.  See also paragraph »Filling« on page
    73.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the right spreading disc by sliding the connector to the right.
    Secure the connector with a lock clip.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the vanes from the left spreading disc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Connect the coupling shaft to the coupling point on the machine shown in
    the relevant spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See also paragraph »Coupling shaft connection point« on page 64.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount the calibration container carefully on the left spreading disc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the calibration container with the settings knob so that the spreading
    disc does not touch the calibration container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Weigh a large trough and place it under the discharging point of the calibration
    container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the control box on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the right spreading disc off.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the PTO shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the left dosing unit.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Allow the spreader to spread for 5 seconds in order to 'rinse' the calibration
    container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing unit.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the PTO shaft and the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition,
    empty the trough and place it back under the discharge point of the calibration
    container.

page_number: 72
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Variable, externally driven application rate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: S
- type: TextItem
  text: RS 232 connection
- type: TextItem
  text: '72'
- type: TextItem
  text: The control system provides the options to distribute the same application
    rate all over the field and the option to spread a variable, externally driven
    application rate. This provides the option to spread as per requirements, e.g.
    through a nitrogen sensor.
- type: TextItem
  text: An application rate that had been preset in the corresponding management system
    for the relevant field can also be entered through the GPS system.
- type: TextItem
  text:  For the options and corresponding settings, see the user's manuals for the
    external system and the control box, e.g. the IsoMatch. The control system of
    the spreader in combination with the IsoMatch control box also transmits the application
    rate and working width used back to the external system.
- type: TextItem
  text: The external system and the control system of a spreader with an IsoMatch
    control box communicate through a serial port with an RS 232 connection. This
    connection is located at the back of the control box. The occupation of pins in
    the 9-point RS 232 plug and the settings required are given in
- type: ListItem
  text:  the user manual of the IsoMatch control box.

page_number: 73
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Filling
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You could come into contact with materials when filling the machine. Always
    wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves, shoes and goggles. Read and adhere
    to the additional safety instructions and the of the material producer. Contact
    with the materials could lead to injury. Contact your physician in such an event!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Chemical reactions caused by mixing fertilisers
- type: TextItem
  text: Mixing different types of fertiliser could lead to a chemical reaction whereby
    poisonous vapours, liquids or other materials could come about. Possible danger
    of explosion! This could lead to personal injury and damage to the crop and machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: Only mix different types of fertiliser if allowed by the manufacturer(s).
- type: TextItem
  text: Chemical reactions could lead to damage to the machines and personal injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Read the safety instructions provided by the supplier
- type: TextItem
  text: Read the safety instructions provided by the supplier and apply that. Protective
    clothing should be worn when necessary.
- type: TextItem
  text: Disregarding the safety instructions could result in personal injury and damage
    to the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use proper tools
- type: TextItem
  text: Great volumes of material is often handled during the filling process. Use
    proper tools such as lifting devices when moving and filling the machine. Keep
    legislation concerning working conditions in mind. Work carefully and responsibly.
    Inferior tools can cause serious inju-
- type: TextItem
  text: ries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only fill mounted machines
- type: TextItem
  text: Never place a machine in the ground while filling it. Always keep it in the
    power lift of the tractor. The machine is designed to be loaded while in a suspended
    state. Never park a filled machine on the ground. Filling the machine while it
    is on the ground could lead to damage.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work with a closed cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser dust can blow indoors through open windows, doors or other openings.
    Moreover, the sound level is higher in an open cabin. It is therefore recommended
    to always work with a closed cabin with active carbon filters in the air inlets.
    Fertiliser dust and a high sound level can cause physical damage.
- type: TextItem
  text: '73'

page_number: 74
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Most types of fertiliser attract water and can thereby form large chunks.
    These chunks can block the spreader or distort the spreading pattern.
- type: ListItem
  text: · When working under moist conditions, use a hopper cover that closes well.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Do not spread without a hopper cover under moist conditions.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Never leave the fertiliser for a long period of time in the spreader. Chunks
    can also be formed through moisture in the air.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Always clean the spreader well after use, including the dosing openings
    and the discharge bushings.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can fill the spreader to the desired levels after it has been put in place.
    It is recommended that the machine be loaded while it is lifted 10 cm above the
    soil. If no activities need to be performed on top of the hopper, the height can
    be adjusted with the automatic filling system.
- type: TextItem
  text: A load platform must be used if the distance between the hopper rim and the
    ground is more than 1250 mm while filling manually or with large bags. The filling
    height is given in
- type: TextItem
  text:  paragraph »Technical specifications« on page 36.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If a fixed loading platform is used, drive the machine to the platform.
    The distance between the machine and the platform must be a maximum of 200 mm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the machine at the desired level. The machine must not rest on the
    ground, but rather be lifted a minimum distance of 10 cm!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if the dosing units are closed. Close them if necessary by pressing
    the stop key on the main screen.
- type: TextItem
  text: The position of the dosing units is displayed in the main screen on the control
    box of the control system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system off.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off and remove the keys from the ignition.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place wheel chocks in front of the wheels of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If a mobile loading platform is being used, place the loading platform at
    the spreader so that there would be a maximum distance of 200 mm between the two.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the hopper cover.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if the sieve is closed and secured.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the machine to the desired level with the correct tools. Fill the hopper
    halves to the same level so that the both of them would run empty at the same
    time.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Loading height
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Working method
- type: TextItem
  text: '74'

page_number: 75
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: Work carefully while filling and take the regulations that apply to working
    conditions into consideration! Make sure no objects or tools fall into the hopper
    . as it could block or damage the spreader!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the hopper cover.
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not exceed the maximum recommended weight!  See also »Technical specifications«
    on page 36. The machine has not been constructed to carry the additional weight.
    Keep the axle load, load capacity of the wheels and the total weight of the tractor
    in mind, as well as the minimum axle load of the tractor.  See also paragraph
    »Calculate the axle load with tractor-mounted
- type: ListItem
  text: machines« on page 13.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION If the weight should increase the filled spreader could fall backwards!
     Set the spreader level length wise after it has been filled.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: If the spreader is filled during the spreading process, e.g. from an auger
    riding alongside the vehicle the automatic calibration must be switched off. With
    automatic calibration the control system weighs the dispersed quantity of fertiliser
    (kg) within a certain time. It also checks these values in terms of the selected,
    preset application rate. The distributed quantity can therefore not be correctly
    weighed if the hopper is filled while spreading. The weight in the hopper could
    even increase during the measurement period. The correction performed by the control
    system would be inaccurate as a result, which could lead to crop damage.
- type: TextItem
  text: '75'

page_number: 76
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading pattern check (tray test)
- type: TextItem
  text: '76'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material
    you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear
    protective clothing and gloves, read the safety instructions provided by the supplier
    and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause physical
    harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: 'It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting the spreader. Work carefully:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you start with
    the adjustments,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: The test should be performed on your own. Operate the machine on your own!
- type: TextItem
  text: Dangerous situations for other people could easily occur when the machine
    is turning and the test conducted. Contact with these materials could cause physical
    injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Protecting the environment
- type: TextItem
  text: Spreading a too high dose of materials outside of the field edge, especially
    on water surface, creates a heavy burden on the environment. Protect the environment
    by applying a correct application rate in a correct working manner.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: PTO shaft rotates after disengaging
- type: TextItem
  text: After switching off the PTO shaft, danger could arise as the machine will
    continue running because of inertia. Keep a safe distance to the machine until
    the moving parts have come to a complete stop. Approaching the machine while it
    is rotating can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work with a closed cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser dust can blow indoors through open windows, doors or other openings.
    Moreover, the sound level is higher in an open cabin. It is therefore recommended
    to always work with a closed cabin with active carbon filters in the air inlets.
    Fertiliser dust and a high sound level can cause physical damage.
- type: TextItem
  text: A tray test checks the distribution of the fertiliser as the spreader distributes
    it. The results of this test will indicate if you can improve the settings of
    the spreader, thereby improving the distribution of fertiliser and limiting loss.
- type: TextItem
  text: Tray tests can be performed by specialised companies, but it is also possible
    to perform this test on your own. You will have to purchase some materials for
    it, however.
- type: TextItem
  text: We recommend that you request a specialist company to perform the tray test
    as they can also provide you with advice and answer your questions.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''

page_number: 77
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'When to perform the tray test:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · When using a fertiliser type that is not in the spreading chart book, via
    the online spreading chart service on the website or via the free application
    (App) for mobile phones with an iOs and/or Android operating system.
- type: ListItem
  text: · When using a fertiliser type of which the distribution and density deviate
    from the values indicated in the spreading chart book, via the online spreading
    chart service on the website or via the free application (App) for mobile phones
    with an iOs and/or Android operating system.
- type: ListItem
  text: · When using fertiliser of moderate quality.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Test should be carried out annually on the left and the right side to check
    the equal distribution of both spreading discs.
- type: ListItem
  text: · After each change to the spreading mechanism of the spreader or when parts
    are replaced.
- type: TextItem
  text: Weather conditions have a great influence on the spreading pattern while spreading,
    as well as while performing the tray test. The tray test should be performed with
    dry weather, low humidity and with a maximum wind speed of 3 m/s (wind force of
    2).
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Material required
- type: ListItem
  text: · measuring tape or ruler,
- type: ListItem
  text: · spirit level to set the troughs horizontal,
- type: ListItem
  text: · 7 troughs,
- type: ListItem
  text: · 7 graduated tubes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · 1 funnel,
- type: ListItem
  text: · notebook, pen and calculator,
- type: ListItem
  text: · this manual.
- type: ListItem
  text: · the instruction manual of the software.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: General instructions
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the preset dosing setting and the discharge point.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the height (75 cm above the troughs) and the position (angle) of the
    spreader.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the rpm of the PTO shaft and the spreader discs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Always place the buckets horizontally on the floor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the buckets at a maximum distance of 4 metres. Provide additional
    widths for testing widths of more than 24 meters. Also, you can first test part
    of the working width and then empty the trays and distribute them over the rest
    of the working width.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do not use the spreader while it is raining or with high humidity. This
    will cause the fertiliser to cling to the troughs, which would not provide the
    desired results.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do not spread with wind speeds of more than 3 m/s (wind force of 2).
- type: TextItem
  text: '77'

page_number: 78
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Test the left and right spreading patterns
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: The left and right spreading discs must spread the same volumes of fertiliser
    to ensure good distribution. Check this every year!
- type: TextItem
  text: This test describes a working width of 24 metres. You are of course free to
    run the test for a different working width. Divide the buckets at equal distances
    along the working width.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the left spreading disc by sliding the connector to he left.
    Secure the connector with a lock clip.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Search the correct discharge position to spread over 24 metres in the best
    comparable fertiliser, seeds or granules (online) spreading chart and set the
    handle accordingly.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Discharge point« on page 65 and the foreword of the spreading
    chart book.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fit the coupling shaft to the correct attachment point of the central gearbox
    as indicated in the associated spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Coupling shaft connection point« on page 64.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the height of the spreader (height of the spreading disc = 75 cm above
    the troughs) .
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the grids in the troughs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place trough 1 in the middle of the tractor tracks.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the other troughs 4 metres to the right of the tractor tracks.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level!
- type: TextItem
  text: '78'

page_number: 79
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the control box on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Enter the required application rate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Enter the working width.
- type: TextItem
  text: It is recommended that an application rate of at least 250 kg/ha is entered
    with the selected driving speed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch on the left spreading disc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the automatic calibration.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the PTO shaft and set the RPM of the spreading discs as given in
    the relevant spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the right dosing unit.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive over the first trough and stop only after you have driven at least
    20 metres past this trough. This is because the spreader distributes roughly even
    to the back, front and to the side.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing unit.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Empty the trough with a funnel into the graduated tubes and record the reading
    in your notebook.
- type: TextItem
  text: Repeat the above procedure, but disconnect the right spreading disc and switch
    the dosing unit of the right spreading disc off. Put the troughs on the left side
    of the tractor track.
- type: TextItem
  text: Drive with the same speed and with the same PTO shaft rpm as with the first
    time!
- type: TextItem
  text: '79'

page_number: 80
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Assessment
- type: ListItem
  text:  Record the values you find in the graduated tubes for the left and right
    spreading discs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Compare the values, calculate the percentage differences between the measuring
    tubes on the left and the right.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adaptation
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the spreading patterns on the left and right spreading discs are not the
    same and the difference is greater than 3% you will have to do the following,
    or request your dealer to do so:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if the machine is hanging horizontally and vertically behind the tractor
    in length and width.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the »Checking and setting the dosing mechanism« as described on
    page 133 and repeat the test.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the »Checking and setting the discharge point setting mechanism«
    as described on page 136 and repeat the test.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the difference in the spreading pattern is too great, contact your dealer.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '80'

page_number: 81
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Full field spreading pattern test
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: If the spreader is correctly set and the tramlines are set at the correct
    distance from each other you would achieve a good distribution of fertiliser over
    the land. This will only be achieved if the spreader spreads with the correct
    spreading pattern.
- type: TextItem
  text: This is then the reason why you have to test the spreading pattern and adjust
    it as required.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See also paragraph »Full field spreading pattern« on page 28.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the spreader as per the details given in the spreading chart for the
    selected working width (X metre) that most closely matches the fertiliser, seeds
    or granules (height of the spreading disc = 75 cm above the troughs) .
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the grids in the troughs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place trough 1 in the middle of the tractor tracks.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Divide the additional 6 buckets on the one side of the track over the actual
    working width of the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: The actual width is twice the size of the effective working width!
- type: TextItem
  text: If you want to spread over a working width of 24 metres, place the buckets
    at 24/6 metres = 4 metres.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '81'

page_number: 82
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the control box on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Enter the required application rate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Key in the new value.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Enter the working width.
- type: TextItem
  text: It is recommended that an application rate of at least 250 kg/ha is entered
    with the selected driving speed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the automatic calibration.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the PTO shaft and set the RPM of the spreading discs as given in
    the relevant spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive along the tracks and open the dosing units a few metres before you
    drive over the first bucket in the middle by pressing the start key.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Only stop spreading after you have driven at least one working width over
    the troughs (e.g. 18 or 24 metres). This is because the spreader distributes roughly
    even to the back, front and to the side.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing units.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive back in the next track, over trough 7. Maintain the same distance
    with opening and closing the dosing units. Keep to the same driving speed and
    PTO shaft rpm!
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you set an application rate of less than 250 kg/ha, drive to and from
    over the same tracks in order to collect sufficient fertiliser in the troughs
    for a good comparison.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintain the same distance with opening and closing the dosing units. Keep
    to the same driving speed and PTO shaft rpm!
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '82'

page_number: 83
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: B
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: C
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Review and adaptation
- type: TextItem
  text: The content of the separate tubes can differ 15% at most from the average.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the correction seems to be 2 characters too strong after repeating the
    test, set the discharge point back by one character.
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    A:
      0: B
      1: C
      2: D
      3: E
    Good spreading pattern, the spreader has been adjusted well:
      0: The spreader is not spreading wide enough.  Adjust the discharge opening
        2 letters in the direction of A  Repeat the test
      1: 'The spreader is spreading too wide:  Adjust the discharge opening 2 letters
        in the direction of U'
      2: 'The spreader is not spreading wide enough (trapezium spreading  pattern):
         Adjust the discharge opening 2 letters in the direction of A  Repeat the
        test'
      3: 'The spreader is spreading too wide (trapezium spreading pattern):  Adjust
        the discharge opening 2 letters in the direction of U  Repeat the test'
- type: TextItem
  text: '83'

page_number: 84
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Testing the spreading pattern of the hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: TextItem
  text: Always perform a calibration test first and determine the correct dosing setting
    before checking the spreading pattern. Changes to the dosing setting will also
    have an influence on the spreading pattern!  See paragraph »Spreading pattern
    check (tray test)« on page 76.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: When using the border spreading plate the aim is to obtain maximum distribution
    to the border with minimum loss in the ditch.
- type: TextItem
  text: This is then why the border spreading plate has to be tested. Do not perform
    this test next to the ditch, rather mark a line behind which the fictive ditch
    will be.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the right or left spreading disc by sliding the connector to
    the right or left. Secure the connector with a lock clip.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing unit of the right or left spreading disc.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION Check that the vanes do not touch the border spreading plate!
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the spreader in accordance with the spreading chart for the desired
    working width and the instructions given in the 'One-sided boundary spreading"
    chapter (height of the spreading disc = 75 cm above the troughs) .
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place 1 trough in the middle of the tractor tracks. The centre of the driving
    track must be 2 metres from the line behind which the fictive ditch is located.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level!
- type: PictureItem
  caption: INDICATION Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level!
- type: TextItem
  text: '84'

page_number: 85
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Setting the hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place 1 trough on the land next to the fictive border ditch and 2 troughs
    next to each other in the fictive ditch.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and engage the PTO shaft. The correct PTO shaft rpm is
    the standard value, less 25%, being 540 rpm - 25% = 400 rpm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Select a gear that would ensure that you drive at the same speed as with
    the normal PTO shaft, or reduce the application rate by 25%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start driving along the field edge. The distance between the border and
    the middle of the tractor must be 2 metres.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the dosing unit a few metres before you get to the middle bucket.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Only stop spreading after you have driven at least one working width over
    the troughs (e.g. 24 metres). This is because the spreader distributes roughly
    even to the back, front and to the side.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you set an application rate of less than 250 kg/ha, drive over the same
    tracks in order to collect sufficient fertiliser in the troughs for a good comparison.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintain the same distance with opening and closing the dosing unit. Keep
    to the same driving speed and PTO shaft rpm!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Empty the troughs with a funnel into the graduated tubes.
- type: TextItem
  text: A hydraulic border spreading plate is available for both sides.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the tap to prevent unintentional lifting of the plate while working.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close off the dosing on the side where no spreading is to be done.
- type: ListItem
  text:  disconnect the drive of the plate on the side where no spreading is to be
    done.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the plate using the (online) spreading chart.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintain the correct disc rpm when spreading.
- type: TextItem
  text: Set the plate more in the direction of position 9 to spread more towards the
    edge.
- type: TextItem
  text: Set the plate more in the direction of position 1 to spread less towards the
    edge.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreading chart shows settings for the yield and H2O positions; for the
    yield position use the standard mounted (short) plates.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '85'

page_number: 86
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: Should you want to use the H2O setting for border spreading, longer plates
    are supplied separately with the hydraulic border spreading plate.
- type: TextItem
  text: In this case, follow the settings of the H2O spreading chart.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: The positions in the H2O position are A to D and are indicated in the spreading
    charts.
- type: ListItem
  text:  refer to the instructions provided for the correct installation of the plates.
- type: TextItem
  text: '86'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''

page_number: 87
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Review and adaptation
- type: TextItem
  text: The maximum acceptable loss in the ditch is determined by environmental standards.In
    order to comply with the standards the quantity of fertiliser in the 1st trough,
    standing in the imaginative ditch, must be a maximum of 10% of the quantity collected
    in the trough in the middle of the track (= 100%).
- type: TextItem
  text: The trough on the land next to the fictive ditch provides an insight into
    the topping. It will never be 100%.
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    0:
      0: A
      1: B
      2: C
    1:
      0: Good spreading pattern, the border spreading plate has been ad- justed well.
      1: The border spreading plate is not spreading wide enough.  Set this small
        part a bit to the right in the direction (9) (= ditch).  Repeat the test.
      2: 'The border spreading plate is spreading too wide:  Set this a bit to the
        left in the direction (1) (= field).  Repeat the test.'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Test the full field spreading pattern next as described in the following
    paragraph.
- type: TextItem
  text: '87'

page_number: 88
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: Testing the full field spreading pattern with the hydraulic border spreading
    plate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Reducing the PTO shaft rpm and closing the right spreading disc also have
    an influence on the spreading pattern on the left side of the spreader. The full
    field spreading pattern should therefore be tested when using the border spreading
    plate.
- type: TextItem
  text: Follow the instructions, adjusted for border spreading, as described in 
    paragraph »Full field spreading pattern test« on page 81.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do not change the position of the border spreading plate and disconnect
    the right or left spreading disc.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'With the first time:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do not change the settings of the spreader, the PTO shaft rpm or the driving
    speed as these should be the same as settings for border spreading.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'With the second time:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lift the border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the spreader for full field spreading.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the RPM of the spreading discs as given in the relevant spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  The driving speed and PTO shaft rpm must be the same as the first time.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Assessment
- type: TextItem
  text: The middle buckets could contain less application rate. The pattern on illustration
    B from
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Full field spreading pattern test« on page 81.
- type: TextItem
  text: This is because of the lower PTO shaft rpm.
- type: TextItem
  text: The level of the middle measuring tube in border spreading could be 25% lower
    than with the outer graduated tubes.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adaptation
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the difference is more than 25%:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Increase the spreading disc rpm by 50 rpm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the full field spreading pattern test with the adjustments for border
    spreading again until the deviation is less than 25%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the spreading pattern test of the border spreading plate anew. Adjust
    the position of the border spreading plate until the loss is below the legal requirements.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '88'

page_number: 89
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Testing ExactLine spreading pattern
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: When using the ExactLine the aim is to obtain maximum distribution to the
    border with minimum loss in the ditch.
- type: TextItem
  text: This is why the ExactLine has to be tested. Do not perform this test next
    to the ditch, rather mark a line behind which the fictive ditch will be.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the spreader as per the details given in the spreading chart for the
    selected working width that most closely matches the fertiliser, seeds or granules
    (height of the spreading disc = 75 cm above the troughs) .
- type: ListItem
  text:  Allow the hydraulic valve to run a few seconds to bring the ExactLine to
    working condition and to put good pressure in the accumulator.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the taps in the hydraulic hose to prevent the ExactLine from ending
    up in a different position by accident.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the ExactLine to the environment setting as per the details given in
    the spreading chart for the desired working width
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Boundary track spreading with ExactLine« on page 110.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '89'

page_number: 90
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: To be done before spreading
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place 1 trough on the land next to the fictive border ditch and 1 trough
    next to each other in the fictive ditch.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'INDICATION:'
- type: TextItem
  text: Position the troughs horizontally with a spirit level!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place 1 trough in the middle of the tractor tracks. The driving track must
    be half a working width from the fictive ditch. Divide the additional buckets
    between the track and the fictive ditch.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and engage the control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the PTO shaft and set the RPM of the spreading discs as per the spreading
    chart or based on the table in
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you want, you can choose to accelerate so that you are driving at the
    same speed as during full field spreading.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the automatic calibration.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive along the tracks and open the dosing units a few metres before you
    drive over the first bucket in the middle by pressing the start key.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Only stop spreading after you have driven at least one working width over
    the troughs (e.g. 18 or 24 metres). This is because the spreader distributes roughly
    even to the back, front and to the side.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing units.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you set an application rate of less than 250 kg/ha, drive over the same
    tracks in order to collect sufficient fertiliser in the troughs for a good comparison.
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintain the same distance with opening and closing the dosing units. Keep
    to the same driving speed and PTO shaft rpm!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Empty the troughs with a funnel into the graduated tubes.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '90'
