      0: The ExactLine is not spreading wide enough.  transport setting)  Repeat
        the test
      1: Adjust this 1 setting wider (e.g. from 3 to 4 or from 7 to
      2: 'The ExactLine is spreading too wide:  Adjust this 1 setting narrower (e.g.
        from 5 to 4 or from  transport setting to 7)  Repeat the test'
- type: TextItem
  text: If you adjust the ExactLine 1 setting higher or lower (e.g. from 1 to 2, or
    from 3 to 2), the working width on the side of the ditch changes roughly 0,3 metres.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Setting the spreading height back to the tray test
- type: TextItem
  text: During the tray test the disc height above the troughs was set to 75 cm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Imagine spreading with the disc height at 75 cm above the ground or crops!
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Spreading height« on page 95.
- type: TextItem
  text: '91'

page_number: 92
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Driving on the road
- type: TextItem
  text: Driving on the road
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Before taking the road
- type: TextItem
  text: '92'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Observe the permissible and safe height with regard to
- type: ListItem
  text: · prescribed maximum height for vehicles in the road traffic regulations,
- type: ListItem
  text: · high-voltage cables or other cables over the road;
- type: ListItem
  text: · anticipated maximum headroom.
- type: TextItem
  text: Pay close attention to these aspects to prevent dangerous situations that
    could lead to major material damage and possibly to serious physical injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Before leaving the tractor:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the PTO shaft off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · release the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the electronic control system off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: That way you make sure that the tractor cannot be started when you are working
    on the machine and that the machine cannot move, which could cause severe physical
    injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Before travelling on a public road with your tractor and machine, you should
    do the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check whether tractor and machine are roadworthy.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the lights, warning indicators, protectors and brakes are attached
    properly and are working.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check whether the reflector, motor vehicle with limited speed (<40km/h)
    on your tractor, is hidden by the implement.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Then fit an additional reflector at the back of the implement.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the run of the quick coupling ropes of the power lift.

page_number: 93
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Preparing the machine to be transported
- type: TextItem
  text: Driving on the road
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Before travelling on a public road with your tractor and machine, you should
    do the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check whether tractor and machine are roadworthy.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the lights, warning indicators, protectors and brakes are attached
    properly and are working.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the run of the quick coupling ropes of the power lift.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fit extra lighting and warning signs, if necessary.
- type: ListItem
  text: ' Check all folding parts and their locking devices:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · hopper cover,
- type: ListItem
  text: · ExactLine
- type: ListItem
  text: · hydraulic border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set all parts of the machine and the tractor, especially the PTO shaft,
    the hydraulics, the wheels and the electric system, to transport mode.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the weight distribution between front and rear axles.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount front weights, if necessary.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the headroom of the combination.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the power lift, if necessary.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lock the control lever of the power lift while moving so that the machine
    is not lowered by accident.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if the lights are in good working order.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check whether the dosing units are closed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove dirt that could fall off while on the road. A dirty road could be
    hazardous for other drivers.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Control devices, e.g. ropes, hoses, etc. for remote actuation of devices
    such as cylinders, shall be guided and positioned in a way they never inadvertently
    release nor block desired movements/actuations!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Always ensure adequate lateral securing of a mounted machine in transport
    position.
- type: TextItem
  text: '93'

page_number: 94
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '94'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Friction between moving parts
- type: TextItem
  text: Be careful of moving parts making contact with each other while working. You
    could accidentally touch control levers and cause the machine to move.
- type: TextItem
  text: Only start working once all machine parts have stopped and the control lever
    have been secured. Wear safety shoes and gloves and work alone. If something gets
    jammed it could lead to personal injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity
- type: TextItem
  text: Check the immediate vicinity and keep a constant eye on it at the start, as
    well as while you are working with the machine. Familiarise yourself with the
    immediate vicinity. Do not start working until all people and obstacles within
    the working area and danger zone of the tractor and machine have been removed.
- type: TextItem
  text: Never stay or allow anyone to stay within the danger area while the machine
    is running! If there are people within the working area and the danger zone it
    could lead to injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Before leaving the tractor:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the PTO shaft off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · release the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the electronic control system off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: That way you make sure that the tractor cannot be started when you are working
    on the machine and that the machine cannot move, which could cause severe physical
    injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: PTO shaft rotates after disengaging
- type: TextItem
  text: After switching off the PTO shaft, danger could arise as the machine will
    continue running because of inertia. Keep a safe distance to the machine until
    the moving parts have come to a complete stop. Approaching the machine while it
    is rotating can cause serious or deadly injuries.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Protecting the environment
- type: TextItem
  text: Spreading a too high dose of materials outside of the field edge, especially
    on water surface, creates a heavy burden on the environment. Protect the environment
    by applying a correct application rate in a correct working manner.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work with a closed cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser dust can blow indoors through open windows, doors or other openings.
    Moreover, the sound level is higher in an open cabin. It is therefore recommended
    to always work with a closed cabin with active carbon filters in the air inlets.
    Fertiliser dust and a high sound level can cause physical damage.

page_number: 95
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Adjusting the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading height
- type: TextItem
  text: Ground level or the top level of the crops
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Ground level or the top level of the crops
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: Most types of fertiliser attract water and can thereby form large chunks.
    These chunks can block the spreader or distort the spreading pattern.
- type: ListItem
  text: · When working under moist weather conditions, use a hopper cover that closes
    well.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Do not spread without a hopper cover under moist conditions.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Never leave the fertiliser for a long period of time in the spreader. Chunks
    can also be formed through moisture in the air.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Always clean the spreader well after use, including the dosing openings
    and the discharge bushings.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Before you can make the first pass, you must make adjustments in the field
    to:'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The following is important to ensure that the spreader works properly:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · set it to the correct height from the ground or above the crop and
- type: ListItem
  text: · by levelling it with the lift rod adjustment and top link.
- type: TextItem
  text: Measured from the bottom of the vanes, the distance to the ground or the crop
    must be 75 cm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Use the power lift to lift the machine to the correct height.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the spreader horizontally with the lift rod adjustment and the top link.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lock the lift limiter in this position.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Height correction with top dressing
- type: TextItem
  text: If the required height of 75 cm above the crop is not possible with your power
    lift
- type: ListItem
  text:  use the high spreading setting of the linkage pins and/or
- type: ListItem
  text:  set the spreader forward as indicated in the spreading charts.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Selecting linkage pin height« on page 53.
- type: TextItem
  text: '95'

page_number: 96
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Last setting check
- type: TextItem
  text: '96'
- type: TextItem
  text: A checklist is given below, as well as in the jacket of the spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do this last check to ensure good spreading results.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Are you working with the correct settings from the correct spreading chart,
    based on:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · distribution,
- type: ListItem
  text: · similar weight,
- type: ListItem
  text: · type of fertiliser,
- type: ListItem
  text: · desired working width,
- type: ListItem
  text: · desired driving speed?
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Did you set the spreader in the correct way? Did you:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · set the height over the ground or crops to 75 cm?
- type: ListItem
  text: · was the correct vane combination mounted?
- type: ListItem
  text: · are the correct number of dosing openings opened (fine application)?
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the correct discharge point set?
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the correct application rate set?
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the correct GEOPOINT® (centre spreading pattern) set?
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the coupling shaft fitted to the correct point on the gearbox?
- type: ListItem
  text: · is the ExactLine or hydraulic border spreading plate in the transport setting
    (or working position)?
- type: ListItem
  text: · are the data required entered in the control system?
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Did you check the following settings:'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Did you:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · have you checked the control system settings?
- type: ListItem
  text: · perform a tray test to check the spreading pattern?
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Work in the correct manner:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Is the field data selected or input correctly?
- type: ListItem
  text: · Is the GEOCONTROL application setting correct?
- type: ListItem
  text: · Have you correctly set the offset?
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Did you set the correct PTO shaft rpm?
- type: ListItem
  text: · Are you driving at the correct driving speed?
- type: ListItem
  text: · Did you set the tramlines at the correct distance?
- type: ListItem
  text: · Wind speed too high?

page_number: 97
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading on field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreading on the headland
- type: TextItem
  text: Filling passes
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Set tramlines
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Working with the GEOCONTROL
- type: TextItem
  text: Starting a new task is done from a saved field or one to be created newly
    with the GEOCONTROL application.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Refer to the GEOCONTROL manual in your terminal for this purpose.
- type: TextItem
  text: A broad headland is desirable in order to make the connection to the headland
    before turning in from the pass. The headland will act as the field boundary and
    is saved in GEOCONTROL.
- type: TextItem
  text: A broad headland is desirable in order to make the connection to the headland
    before turning in from the pass.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Spread a broad or double headland so that you make the connection while
    driving straight before making a turn.
- type: TextItem
  text: Thereafter, the field can be filled in full passes. You can create a (spray)track
    pattern for following processes.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Prevent drive errors
- type: TextItem
  text: It is important that the spreading patterns overlap well to ensure good distribution.
    A difference in the overlapping is less vital with average working widths, using
    a triangular spreading pattern.
- type: TextItem
  text: Differences in the spreading pattern would easily be noticed with a trapezium
    shape on very large working widths, in particular. The overlap of the spreading
    pattern is then much smaller and therefore more sensitive to mistakes.
- type: TextItem
  text: This can be prevented by setting tramlines before hand. This can be done by
    setting out tramlines on the headlands and marking them with, for example, picket
    poles.
- type: TextItem
  text: Visibility of the from headland to headland is very important. Place additional
    markers in the field if necessary to ensure that the track is clearly visible.
- type: TextItem
  text: When controlled by the GEOCONTROL the spreader has the option of reducing
    the working width in order to connect the incomplete final pass with the next
    one.
- type: TextItem
  text: '97'

page_number: 98
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Tramline patterns
- type: TextItem
  text: Using the ExactLine with tramlines
- type: TextItem
  text: '98'
- type: TextItem
  text: Your preferred border spreading method determines the tramline pattern.
- type: TextItem
  text: Select on the basis of the site width, the presence of the spreader tramlines
    and the spreader's equipment.
- type: TextItem
  text: Drive half the working width from the field edge (1/2 X meters) when doing
    boundary track spreading with ExactLine (optional extra).
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the first way at half the working width (1/2 X meter) from the field
    edge (in the first sprayer tramline).
- type: ListItem
  text:  The paths that follow are set at the full working width.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Boundary track spreading with ExactLine« on page 110.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text: 'TIP: Indicate whether the field boundary is to the right of the machine while
    spreading the headland in the GEOCONTROL!'

page_number: 99
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Using the hydraulic border spreading plate with tramlines
- type: TextItem
  text: During one-sided boundary spreading with hydraulic border spreading plate,
    you drive along the outermost work area on the field edge and control the fertiliser
    granule stream by means of the hydraulic border spreading plate (accessory).
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The paths that follow are set at:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · half the working width of Situation A (the first sprayer tramline),
- type: ListItem
  text: · the complete working width Situation B.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »One-sided boundary spreading with the hydraulic border spreading
    plate« on page 107.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text: 'TIP: Indicate that the field boundary is to the right of the machine while
    spreading the headland in the GEOCONTROL!'
- type: TextItem
  text: '99'
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field

page_number: 100
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Start spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Connect headland with the GEOCONTROL function
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Overlap on the headland
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Overlap on the field boundary
- type: TextItem
  text: '100'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'To begin spreading, proceed as follows:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close all the doors and windows in the cabin.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive the tractor to the first tramline, depending on the driving pattern
    required, which may be recognised by the marker in place.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the control box on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the settings as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  Without GEOCONTROL, select and activate a site number in the field registration,
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch on the PTO shaft and set the correct spreading disc rpm as reported
    in the spreading chart.
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not allow the spreading disc to run for longer than is necessary while
    the dosing units are closed. This will prevent the agitator from grinding the
    fertiliser.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start driving and open the dosing units at the same time by pressing the
    start key.
- type: TextItem
  text: The rpm of the tractor engine (therefore also of the PTO shaft) must remain
    constant while spreading (with regards to distributing fertiliser along the width).
- type: TextItem
  text: The driving speed can only be adjusted by selecting another speed!
- type: TextItem
  text: Based on the offset set in the 'TC Implement Settings' screen, the GEOCONTROL
    will switch the spreading sections off by itself when passing the headland limit.
    This happens if the spreading pattern overlaps completely and you run up the headland.
- type: TextItem
  text: Depending on the set overlap percentage, the connection on the headland and
    gores will more or less overlap.
- type: TextItem
  text: The usual setting is 50%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the GEOCONTROL manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: Even the extent of overlap of the field boundary created can be separately
    set in the GEOCONTROL manual.
- type: ListItem
  text: TIP Set the overlap on the field boundary to 0 if you do not wish to spread
    over the field boundary.

page_number: 101
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'approaching headland with the GEOCONTROL function switched off:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing units by pressing the stop key before turning to the headland.
    The PTO shaft can keep running if you intend to start spreading immediately again.
- type: TextItem
  text: You will find the correct working method and corresponding distances on the
    headland in
- type: ListItem
  text:  the next paragraph »Working method on the headland« and paragraph »Spreading
    on field« from page 97.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive to the next tramline and re-start the spreader at the right time,
    as displayed in the next paragraph »Working method on the headland«.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In the event of spreader failure or stoppage:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Stop spreading immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  See then paragraph »Failure and stoppage« on page 113.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the hopper content becomes less than 100 kg, the control system switches
    off the automatic calibration. Measurement accuracy declines in such a way that
    new automatic calibration cannot produce a better discharge curve.
- type: TextItem
  text: At low doses <50 kg/ha, it is possible to reduce the minimum hopper capacity
    for automatic calibration to minus 15 kg.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the spreader is filled during the spreading process, e.g. from an auger
    riding alongside the vehicle the automatic calibration must be switched off. With
    automatic calibration the control system weighs the dispersed quantity of fertiliser
    (kg) within a certain time. It also checks these values in terms of the selected,
    preset application rate. The distributed quantity can therefore not be correctly
    weighed if the hopper is filled while spreading. The weight in the hopper could
    even increase during the measurement period. The correction performed by the control
    system would be inaccurate as a result, which could lead to crop damage.
- type: TextItem
  text: '101'

page_number: 102
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Working method on the headland
- type: TextItem
  text: '102'
- type: TextItem
  text: The driving pattern that you use, in other words how you must turn on the
    headland, depends on your border spreading method.
- type: ListItem
  text: · spreading the border from the sprayer tramline with ExactLine, one-sided
    boundary spreading with additional room with the border spreading plate (situation
    A), or
- type: ListItem
  text: · border spreading by closing off one disc and using a border spreading plate
    (situation B).
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Do the following when spreading the headland:'
- type: TextItem
  text: For boundary track spreading from the sprayer tramline (ExactLine and situation
    A)
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: GEOCONTROL headland function ExactLine
- type: ListItem
  text:  Begin with creating the field boundary where you spread on edges with the
    ExactLine while driving to the left through the first sprayer tramline.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Make a second round with the ExactLine switched off for a double headland,
    if required.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the field with injections on your sprayer tramline defined previously.
- type: TextItem
  text: The GEOCONTROL will itself determine the correct start/stop moment while approaching
    and turning from the spread headland.

page_number: 103
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the field boundary as close as possible along the field boundary while
    driving to the left or to the right, to spread right down to the border with the
    border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the headland through to half the working width without the border spreading
    plate with the right/left dosing closed to make an additional pass.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See »One-sided boundary spreading with the hydraulic border spreading plate«
    on page 107.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the field with injections on your sprayer tramline defined previously.
- type: TextItem
  text: The GEOCONTROL will itself determine the correct start/stop moment while approaching
    and turning from the spread headland.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Spreading without GEOCONTROL headland:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Stop spreading by closing the dosing units of the machine when you are half
    a working width from the end of the land.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Let the spreading discs turns and do not switch off the PTO shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the dosing units again at one and a half the working width of the field
    edge.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Finally spread the field edges with the ExactLine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Border spreading« on page 106.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: With one-sided border spreading (situation B)
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '103'

page_number: 104
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: GEOCONTROL headland function
- type: TextItem
  text: '104'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Begin with creating the field boundary where you spread down to the border
    along the field boundary while driving to the left/right with the border spreading
    plate and the right/left dosing switched off.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the field with injections on your sprayer tramline defined previously.
- type: TextItem
  text: The GEOCONTROL will interrupt and start the process at the correct time while
    turning on the headland.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Without GEOCONTROL
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive as closely as possible to the end of the property and stop spreading
    by closing the dosing units before you turn.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Let the spreading discs turns and do not switch off the PTO shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the dosing units again when you are a full working width down from
    the end of the land.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Finally spread the field edges with the border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Border spreading« on page 106.

page_number: 105
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Over and underdosing
- type: TextItem
  text: Results of one-sided over- or underdosing
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: Depending on soil or crop composition, it is preferable to spread more or
    less fertiliser locally. With the control system, you can over- or under dose
    to the left, right or on both sides during spreading. You will find all the control
    keys on the main screen.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreading pattern of both spreading discs overlap partially, especially
    in the middle behind the spreader. For this reason, the real application rate
    will deviate from the one that you set during one-sided over- and under dosing.
    You will see the effect especially with narrow working widths because that is
    when the spreading patterns overlap the most.
- type: TextItem
  text: With small working widths in which you spread in a triangular spreading pattern,
    the first and second passes of the spreading patterns overlap each other completely.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See also paragraph »Spreading pattern« on page 28. To distribute an adjusted
    application rate you must therefore over- or underdose on the first as well as
    the second pass in the following tramline.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '105'

page_number: 106
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Border spreading
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: '106'
- type: TextItem
  text: Spreading fertiliser up to the border of the property requires concentration.
    On the one hand you want to achieve maximum cover to the field edge to ensure
    a good crop, while on the other hand you want to minimise the loss over the field
    edge.
- type: TextItem
  text: The spreader has 2 different functions and accessories to cater for border
    spreading.
- type: ListItem
  text: · one-sided boundary spreading with the hydraulic border spreading plate,
- type: ListItem
  text: · boundary track spreading with ExactLine.
- type: TextItem
  text: When one-sided boundary spreading, drive with the tractor along the field
    edge and spread from the border inwards. With boundary track spreading, drive
    down the first sprayer tramline from the field edge and spray in the direction
    of the border.
- type: TextItem
  text: We advise you to spread the site first before you spread the borders. During
    border spreading, the control system does not perform any automatic calibration,
    so it cannot accurately determine the correct dosing setting for the required
    application rate. Consequently, the application rate can deviate from the required
    application rate during border spreading. By spreading the field first, the control
    system can determine the correct dosing setting and thus spread at the correct
    application rate, also during border spreading.

page_number: 107
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: One-sided boundary spreading with the hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: Drive along the field edge when one-sided boundary spreading and send the
    flow of fertiliser granules with the hydraulic border spreading plate (optional
    extra). The working width on the side of the field edge can be adjusted by changing
    the hydraulic border spreading plate (optional extra).
- type: TextItem
  text: Direction ( 1 ) (environmental set- ting)
- type: TextItem
  text: Spread less to the field edge.
- type: TextItem
  text: This will decrease the loss over the field edge, but the cover will not be
    as good
- type: TextItem
  text: Direction ( 9 ) (yield setting)
- type: TextItem
  text: Spread more to the field edge.
- type: TextItem
  text: Cover is better, but the loss is greater
- type: TextItem
  text: The maximum acceptable loss over the field edge is determined by environment
    standards. In order to comply with the standard the quantity of fertiliser spread
    beyond the field edge must be a maximum of 10% of the quantity distributed in
    the centre behind the spreader (= 100%). Test if the border spreading plate (optional
    extra) door de test therefore always before hand as described in
- type: TextItem
  text:  paragraph »Testing the spreading pattern of the hydraulic border spreading
    plate« on page 84.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '107'

page_number: 108
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Procedure with hydraulic border spreading plate
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '108'
- type: TextItem
  text: Left and right border spreading is possible with the hydraulic border spreading
    plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off and remove the keys from the ignition.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the right spreading disc by sliding the connector to the right.
    Secure the connector with a lock clip.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the border plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the vanes do not touch the border spreading plate!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Adjust the spreader based on the details given in the spreading chart for
    the desired working width. Use the same settings and coupling shaft mounting point
    as with full field spreading,
- type: ListItem
  text:  See also paragraph »Setting the spreader« on page 62.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the control box on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the PTO shaft. The correct rpm of the spreading discs is the value
    of the relevant spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you want, you can choose to accelerate so that you are driving at the
    same speed as during full field spreading.
- type: TextItem
  text: The control system will drive the dosing units in such a way that the actual
    application rate is equal to the set application rate through the lower PTO shaft
    RPM.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In the event of spreader failure or stoppage:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Stop spreading immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  See then paragraph »Failure and stoppage« on page 113.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'After border spreading:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lift the border spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Reconnect the drive of the right spreading disc.

page_number: 109
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Driving pattern
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: Two different driving patterns can be used, depending on the situation on
    your land.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Working from the sprayer tramlines (situation A):'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive the first path with the middle of the tractor about 2 metres from
    the field edge. Decrease the PTO shaft rpm to 75%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the border spreading plate at the end of the first pass or raise
    the hydraulic border spreading plate, but disconnect the right spreading disc
    and close the dosing unit,
- type: ListItem
  text:  see the methods above.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Increase the PTO shaft rpm to 100% again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive down the second path in the first sprayer tramline.
- type: ListItem
  text:  After the second operation, link up the right spreading disc drive again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the dosing unit of the right spreading disc.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Working without sprayer tramlines (situation B):'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive the first path with the middle of the tractor about 2 metres from
    the field edge. Decrease the PTO shaft rpm to 75%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the border spreading plate at the end of the first pass or raise
    the hydraulic spreading plate.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Reconnect the drive of the right spreading disc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the dosing unit of the right spreading disc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive up the second line 1 working width from the field edge (X metres).
    Maintain the distance with the field edge carefully by using pickets, for instance.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '109'

page_number: 110
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Boundary track spreading with ExactLine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Operation
- type: TextItem
  text: ExactLine
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ExactLine
- type: TextItem
  text: Setting
- type: TextItem
  text: '110'
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Drive half the working width from the field edge (1/2 X meters) (=first sprayer
    tramline) when doing boundary track spreading with the ExactLine (accessory).
    The flow of fertiliser granules, seeds or other granules spread with ExactLine.
    The working width on the side of the field edge can be adjusted by changing the
    ExactLine position.
- type: TextItem
  text: The maximum acceptable loss over the field edge is determined by environment
    standards. In order to comply with the standard the quantity of fertiliser spread
    beyond the field edge must be a maximum of 10% of the quantity distributed in
    the centre behind the spreader (= 100%). Test the ExactLine therefore always in
    advance as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Testing ExactLine spreading pattern« on page 89.
- type: TextItem
  text: The (online) spreading charts indicate the correct setting for the ExactLine
    and the relevant rpm for the PTO shaft and the spreading discs.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the settings of the ExactLine are not given in the relevant spreading
    chart they can be obtained in the following sources:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · find with the online spreading chart service on the website or via the Free
    Application (App) for mobile phones with an iOs and/or Android operating system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Online spreading chart service« on page 61.
- type: TextItem
  text: Always check the settings of the ExactLine by performing the test as described
    in
- type: TextItem
  text:  paragraph »Testing ExactLine spreading pattern« on page 89.
- type: TextItem
  text: The type of fertiliser is determined when adjusting the spreader, as described
    in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Determine the type and pattern of the granules« on page 57.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'you can choose from 3 settings from the chart:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · YIELD.
- type: ListItem
  text: · ECO,
- type: TextItem
  text: In the yield setting (YIELD), the loss over the field edge is higher than
    what is allowed by the environmental standard. Therefore, never use this setting
    next to surface water. Cover to the border is very good with this option.
- type: TextItem
  text: The loss over the field edge will be equal to or less than the environment
    standard in the environment setting (ECO). Always use this setting when working
    next to a surface water! The result is that the cover at the border of the property
    is not optimum.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.

page_number: 111
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Working method
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Accumulator
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the ExactLine by letting the relevant single-acting hydraulic valve
    run for a few seconds. This is also how pressure is built in the accumulator.
    You will see the ExactLine symbol on the main screen. The symbol only appears
    when the ExactLine is in working position.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the tap on the hydraulic hose to prevent the ExactLine from changing
    position while spreading due to a leaking tractor valve.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Do not change the settings of the spreader.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Setting the spreader« on page 62.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the ExactLine to the required position, based on the spreading chart,
    online spreading chart.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and set the correct PTO shaft and spreading discs RPM,
    based on the spreading chart, online spreading chart or the chart on the previous
    page.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you want, you can choose to accelerate so that you are driving at the
    same speed as during full field spreading.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Continue operating the spreader in the same way as in full field spreading,
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Start spreading« on page 100.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check regularly while spreading to see if the symbol of the ExactLine remains
    on screen. If the symbol disappears the ExactLine is no longer in a good working
    position.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the ExactLine back to transport mode after use by opening the tap in
    the hydraulic hose and then opening the relevant single-acting hydraulic valve
    for a few seconds.
- type: TextItem
  text: The ExactLine's position is displayed on the main screen if you have connected
    this function.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: ListItem
  text: In this way, you will make fewer spreading errors caused by an incorrectly
    positioned ExactLine.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'In the event of spreader failure or stoppage:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Stop spreading immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  See then paragraph »Failure and stoppage« on page 113.
- type: TextItem
  text: '111'

page_number: 112
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Driving pattern
- type: TextItem
  text: When using the ExactLine, drive in the first sprayer tramline or half the
    working width (1/2 X meter) from the field edge.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Stopping work
- type: TextItem
  text: '112'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Right after working with the machine, before you leave, you must do the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the dosing units.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the pto shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system off.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off and remove the keys from the ignition.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove remains from the crop, dirt and stones from the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fix the hopper cover.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Take all appropriate measures for road transport.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Preparing the machine to be transported« on page 93.

page_number: 113
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Failure and stoppage
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Causes
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: 'It is also easy to get injured while working with the spreader. Work safely
    with the machine:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you approach it,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: While working with the spreader, you might come into contact with fertiliser
    or other substances that you want to spread. Wear protective clothing and gloves,
    read the safety instructions provided by the supplier and follow their directions.
    Contact with these materials could cause physical harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'During spreading, if you:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · see that a spreading disc is spreading irregularly or not at all while the
    dosing units are open,
- type: ListItem
  text: · hear a loud noise,
- type: ListItem
  text: · become aware that the machine is vibrating seriously,
- type: ListItem
  text: · an alarm is shown on the main screen indicating that the PTO shaft is not
    connected, while it actually is connected,
- type: ListItem
  text: · an alarm will appear on the main screen, indicating that the dosing units
    cannot be closed,
- type: ListItem
  text:  see the software instruction manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: Stop spreading immediately! Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
- type: TextItem
  text: '113'

page_number: 114
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Working method
- type: TextItem
  text: '114'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: 'These failures are probably caused by one of the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · a hard object blocks the agitator,
- type: ListItem
  text: · a hard object or a large piece of fertiliser is (partially) blocking the
    supply from flowing to the agitator,
- type: ListItem
  text: · a hard object or a large piece of fertiliser is (partially) blocking fertiliser
    from flowing through the dosing opening or discharge bushing,
- type: ListItem
  text: · crushed and/or damp fertiliser forms an encrusted layer beneath the agitator
    and blocks the flow through the dosing openings,
- type: ListItem
  text: · a lump of damp fertiliser has formed in the discharge bushing and is blocking
    flow from the discharge bushing opening. This happens especially when the spreader
    has not been thoroughly cleaned after it was last used.
- type: TextItem
  text: Most types of fertiliser attract water and can thereby form large chunks.
    These chunks can block the spreader or distort the spreading pattern.
- type: ListItem
  text: · When working under moist conditions, use a hopper cover that closes well.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Do not spread without a hopper cover under moist conditions.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Never leave the fertiliser for a long period of time in the spreader. Chunks
    can also be formed through moisture in the air.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Always clean the spreader well after use, including the dosing openings
    and the discharge bushings.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Handle with care
- type: TextItem
  text: Cautiously approach the machine and handle with care. There could be hot or
    live parts! Contact with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: To find the cause of the failure or stoppage and solve it as far as possible,
    proceed as follows.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the PTO shaft immediately!
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the electronic control system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    handbrake of the tractor.
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not place the machine on the ground. Placing a filled machine on the ground
    damages the structure!

page_number: 115
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Damage
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Close the sieve
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: ListItem
  text:  Examine the spreading discs and the discharge opening to see what the cause
    of the failure/stoppage is.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Adapt the discharge point as needed for easier access.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If you still cannot see the cause, carefully remove the vanes to see better
    into the discharge opening of the discharge bushing.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Pass an object such as a screwdriver through the discharge opening and carefully
    feel if you can find an object in or damage to the dosing openings or agitator.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you see damage to the vanes, spreading disc or discharge bushing, the failure
    is most likely caused by a hard object. The agitator is probably damaged too.
    You must first repair the damage or have it repaired before continuing with spreading.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place an object, for example a cloth or bag, in the discharge opening of
    the discharge bushing on the damaged side. . This will prevent you from wasting
    fertiliser during transport.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and engage the control box. The dosing units will now
    close.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Take all appropriate measures for road transport.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Preparing the machine to be transported« on page 93.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'On the site of a lockable storage depot:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Empty the hopper without positioning the machine on the ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the sieve closure with an attachment, standard supplied with the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Lock the sieve in the open position
- type: TextItem
  text: If you open the sieves, you should lock them to prevent unwanted closing.
    Accidental closure could lead to serious injury.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the object that caused the damage.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Repair the machine or have your dealer do it.
- type: TextItem
  text: '115'

page_number: 116
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Use in the field
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: stoppage
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Close the sieve
- type: TextItem
  text: Locking the opened sieve
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Close the sieveLocking the opened sieve
- type: TextItem
  text: Sieve clip locked
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Sieve clip locked
- type: TextItem
  text: '116'
- type: TextItem
  text: If you have not found any damage, the failure is probably due to stoppage
    from an encrusted layer of fertiliser.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Try to reduce the size of the lump or encrusted layer with an object such
    as a stick, screwdriver or vane.
- type: TextItem
  text: If you open the filters to reduce the lump or encrusted layer from the top
    side, you should block them to prevent unwanted closing.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If you can reduce the lump or encrusted layer in this way:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Inspect the hopper contents for other lumps and reduce them.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fit the vanes and secure them with the lock nut.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the discharge point setting.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the hopper cover.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Continue spreading.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If you have not managed to reduce the lump or encrusted layer because it
    is out of reach or there is no tool at your disposal:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the hopper cover.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Follow the working method as described in the previous paragraph »Damage«
    until emptying the hopper.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove or reduce the lump or encrusted layer.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If necessary, dry the hopper and the dosing mechanism.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Opening the sieve clip
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the sieve closure with an attachment, standard supplied with the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lock the sieve to prevent it from closing accidentally.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the sieves and check the lock.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Refill the spreader.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the fertiliser for lumps before and after filling.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the hopper cover.

page_number: 117
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: It is easy to come into contact with the materials when putting away the machine.
    Always wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves, shoes and goggles. Read
    and adhere to the additional safety instructions and the of the material producer.
    Contact with the materials could lead to injury. Contact your physician in such
    an event!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: 'It is also easy to get injured while working with the spreader. Work safely
    with the machine:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you approach it,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Protect the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser and other salts have a great influence on the rate of corrosion.
    Empty the hopper at the end of activities. Protect the machine by always cleaning
    it after using such material and patch breaks in the paint. Corrosion affects
    the strength of the construction and the operation of the machine, which could
    lead to a shortened lifespan. After cleaning, inject the (white) metal parts of
    the machine with the supplied preserving liquid point for protection against corrosion
    of the
- type: TextItem
  text: machine, read the instructions before use.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful while cleaning with high pressure cleaners
- type: TextItem
  text: You can clean the machine with water or steam, possibly using only suitable
    cleaning tools. Also read here and adhere to the safety instructions of the material
    manufacturer.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Only use low pressure and temperature; 80 bar and maximum 40 o C.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Keep the nozzle more than 30 cm clear of turning parts, sensors, parts of
    the electric system, hydraulic hoses, stickers and plastic parts.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Only spray perpendicular to sticker edges.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Waste storage and disposal
- type: TextItem
  text: The waste water from cleaning the machine is contaminated with fertiliser
    and possibly also with lubrications. Collect the waste and dispose of it in terms
    of national regulations.
- type: TextItem
  text: '117'

page_number: 118
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Cleaning
- type: TextItem
  text: '118'
- type: TextItem
  text: It is advisable to first lubricate, clean and again lubricate the machine
    before storing it for a short or longer period of time. If it is lubricated first
    you will prevent dirt, fertiliser and water from entering the bearings. After
    cleaning, grease and oil all items once again for conservation.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The advantages of this working order are:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · additional checks on the machine right after work,
- type: ListItem
  text: · ensuring the longevity of the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · less delays due to problems while working with the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lubricate the machine grease nipples.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Lubricating points« on page 126.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Clean the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lubricate the machine grease nipples once again.
- type: TextItem
  text: When using a high-pressure cleaner, do not aim it at the seals and the breathers.
    That way you will prevent dirt and moisture from entering the gearboxes.
- type: TextItem
  text: Furthermore, do not set up electrical components. Water can cause electrical
    failures.
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''

page_number: 119
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Disconnecting the machine
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Disconnect safely
- type: TextItem
  text: You may only disconnect the machine when
- type: ListItem
  text: · all parts are in a safe condition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · your immediate vicinity is safe,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the hopper is empty.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: 'Work carefully:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · check the environment (children!) and ensure that nobody is in the vicinity
    of the tractor or the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the machine or parking support must only be placed on a straight, firm surface,
- type: ListItem
  text: · never stand between the tractor and machine while the power lift is operated
    externally while disconnecting the machine. Using the power lift entails the risk
    of accidents by crushing or jack-knifing,
- type: ListItem
  text: · operate the power lift slowly and carefully,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the power lift during disconnection must be placed in such a position that
    accidental release or lowering would be eliminated,
- type: ListItem
  text: · sufficient distance must be maintained between parts (e.g. parking support)
    that rest on the ground.
- type: TextItem
  text: Working unsafely could cause serious injuries.
- type: TextItem
  text: Proceed as follows to store the machine in stable condition for a shorter
    or longer period.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch off the pto shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the ExactLine hydraulic hose tap is closed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the ExactLine hydraulic hose tap of the hydraulic border spreading
    plate is closed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Take the pressure off the hydraulic system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on a stable, level base.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system off.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Adjust the length of the top link in such a way that it is no longer live.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Release the top link by undoing the release rope from the catch hooks and
    pulling the top link up.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Release the lower links by undoing the release ropes from the catch hooks
    and lowering the power lift as far as possible.
- type: TextItem
  text: '119'

page_number: 120
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: ListItem
  text: TIP If you cannot lower the power lift far enough to release the catch hooks,
    we advise you to place the spreader on a firm, stable ramp, for example a pawl.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive the tractor about 200 mm forward (maximum distance depends on the
    range of the coupling shaft; the halves must always overlap each other).
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Put wheel chocks in place to ensure that a machine equipped with parking
    wheels would not roll away.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the electric plugs and hang them in the container.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the hydraulic hoses.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the protective caps on the hydraulic hose connections.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Hang the hydraulic hoses in the hose coupling support.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disconnect the coupling shaft and hook it up.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the machine is equipped with parking wheels:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Drive the machine to the desired parking place.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place wheel chocks in front of the parking wheels.
- type: TextItem
  text: Container for electrical plugs and hydraulic hoses
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '120'

page_number: 121
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Preparation for winter storage
- type: TextItem
  text: Storing the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: At the end of the season the machine must be prepared for winter storage.
- type: TextItem
  text: It is advisable to first lubricate, clean and again lubricate the machine
    before storing it for a short or longer period of time. If it is lubricated first
    you will prevent dirt, fertiliser and water from entering the bearings. After
    cleaning, grease and oil all items once again for conservation.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The advantages of this method of working are:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · additional checks on the machine right after work,
- type: ListItem
  text: · ensuring the longevity of the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · less delays due to problems while working with the machine.
- type: TextItem
  text: TIP When using a high-pressure cleaner, do not aim it at the seals and the
    breathers. That way you will prevent dirt and moisture from entering the gearboxes.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: Furthermore, do not set up electrical components. Water can cause electrical
    failures.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See »Be careful while cleaning with high pressure cleaners« on page 117,
- type: ListItem
  text:  Clean the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Let the machine dry.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Paint any damaged paintwork.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lubricate and oil all points once again to ensure conservation.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Maintenance intervals« on page 125.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Provide white parts such as piston rods of hydraulic cylinders with preservative
    grease or inject the (white) metal parts of the machine with preserving liquid
    (supplied) for protection against corrosion.
- type: TextItem
  text: Only use grease that would not harden or dry. That will prevent damage to
    cylinder oil seals.
- type: TextItem
  text: '121'

page_number: 122
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: TextItem
  text: '122'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Repair damage safely and without delay
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Repair the machine safely before you continue with work:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · place the tractor and machine on a firm, straight surface,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the PTO shaft,
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · disconnect the tractor if possible,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait until all parts have stopped moving. The mass (inertia) could keep
    the machine running for a bit!
- type: ListItem
  text: · place wheel chocks in front of the wheels of a machine with parking wheels
    to prevent it from rolling away,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given,
- type: ListItem
  text: · use the correct tools,
- type: ListItem
  text: · bigger or heavier parts must be locked and secured to lifting gear when
    being replaced,
- type: ListItem
  text: · parts that could move unintentionally must be supported and secured,
- type: ListItem
  text: · do not climb on parts of the machine that are not in use. Only use stepladders,
    ladders or other tools intended for this purpose.
- type: ListItem
  text: · disconnect the feed while working on the electric system.
- type: ListItem
  text: · disconnect the cables from the battery and the dynamo before arc welding
    on the tractor or the connected machine!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Performed by an authorised person
- type: TextItem
  text: Always have an authorised expert perform maintenance and repairs as prescribed
    in, as prescribed in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Authorisation« on page 11.
- type: TextItem
  text: All forms of responsibility of the manufacturer become null and void and the
    guarantee lapses if maintenance and repair work are performed by an unauthorised
    person.

page_number: 123
items:
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not modify the machine
- type: TextItem
  text: Do not modify the machine in any way. Unauthorised modifications may impair
    the function and/or safety and affect the life of the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Only use original parts when replacing
- type: TextItem
  text: Using other non-genuine parts could lead to problems and unsafe situations
    when using the machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Accessories and parts must be correctly mounted
- type: TextItem
  text: Assemble accessories and parts according to specifications and attach them
    only for their designated purpose; ensure that it is locked correctly. Accessories
    and parts which are not fastened securely could lead to personal injury and damage
    to the crop and machine.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Tighten all bolts and nuts
- type: TextItem
  text: Check that all the nuts and bolts are well set. Check this again after one
    hour of use
- type: ListItem
  text: · after delivery and
- type: ListItem
  text: · after maintenance or repairs have been carried out.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid jamming under the sieves
- type: TextItem
  text: There is a risk that parts of your body may get jammed in the hopper during
    maintenance activities or when closing the sieves. Secure the sieve in an open
    position and unlock the sieves on the outside. Jamming could cause injury.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with materials
- type: TextItem
  text: You should only come into contact with the materials when cleaning the machine.
    Always wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves, shoes and goggles. Read
    and adhere to the additional safety instructions and the of the material producer.
    Contact with the materials could lead to injury. Contact your physician in such
    an event!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Explosion danger because of nitrate
- type: TextItem
  text: Fertiliser that contains nitrate can create an explosion danger if it should
    come into contact with fire. All fertiliser remnants should therefore be removed
    from voids, corners, tubes and tubing before welding, cutting or grinding on the
    machine. An explosion will cause damage to the machine and could lead to personal
    injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: Adhere to all the safety precautions as described in  paragraph »Safety requirements«
    from page 10.
- type: TextItem
  text: '123'

page_number: 124
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Oil and grease content
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Never use more oil or grease than prescribed
- type: TextItem
  text: A too high oil level may result in an overheated machine and damaged seals.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Waste storage and disposal
- type: TextItem
  text: Waste from performing maintenance on the machine could be contaminated with
    fertiliser, oil and grease. Collect the waste and dispose of it in terms of national
    regulations.
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    Part / action:
      0: Central gearbox gearboxes of the spreading discs
      1: Lubricate with grease Lubricate with oil
    Quantity:
      0: 2 x 0.25 litre 1.5 litres
      1: 1 to 2 times
    Specifications:
      0: EP00/000 gear grease EP00/000 gear grease
      1: Shell Rodina 2, Castrol GS2 or equivalent MIL-L-2105C, SAE 80W-90
- type: TextItem
  text: '124'

page_number: 126
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Lubricating points
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Coupling shaft with quick lock
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Discharge bushings
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Actuators
- type: TextItem
  text: Grease nipples
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Grease nipples
- type: TextItem
  text: '126'
- type: TextItem
  text: All lubricating nipples of the machine can be filled with a universal grease
    type.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See »Oil and grease content« on page 124.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See »Maintenance intervals« on page 125.
- type: TextItem
  text: The coupling shaft is provided with grease nipples.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lubricate the nipples.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the condition of the protection sleeves and the check chains.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Replace them if damaged.
- type: TextItem
  text: The discharge bushings are attached lower down to the agitator axle and have
    2 grease nipples.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the discharge bushings
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the software instruction manual.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the spreading disc by hand until both grease nipples are visible.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Grease the 2 nipples of both discharge bushings.
- type: TextItem
  text: The actuators are provided with 1 grease nipple.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Grease the nipple of all four actuators.

page_number: 127
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Applying or adding grease
- type: TextItem
  text: Coupling shaft profiled tubes You must grease the profiled tubes of the coupling
    shaft regularly. Ap-
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Central gear box
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: gearboxes of the spreading discs
- type: TextItem
  text: There is grease in the gearbox below the spreading discs. The level of the
    grease under the filler opening must be 35 mm when the machine has been standing
    still for a short time.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove dirt, fertiliser or grease from the gearbox.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the gearbox by removing the cap from the filler opening.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Measure the level of the grease.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Add grease until the desired level is reached.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the filler opening.
- type: TextItem
  text: ply grease to the contact surfaces of both of the profiled tubes should you
    note during coupling or decoupling that the halves of the coupling shaft are not
    sliding in and out smoothly. This should at any rate be done at least once per
    season.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Detach the coupling shaft on the one side.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Pull the shaft halves away from each another.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Grease the running surface of the inner profiled tube.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Slide the coupling shaft halves into each other.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Attach the coupling shaft.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Hook the check chains to the tractor side.
- type: TextItem
  text: The central gearbox consists of 2 compartments filled with gear wheel grease
    EP 00/000. The grease in principle never needs to be replaced.
- type: TextItem
  text: Each compartment holds 0.25 litre.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the level regularly.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove dirt, fertiliser or grease from the gearbox.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the cap from the dipstick and filler opening.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fill the gear box with new grease until it almost comes out of the opening.
- type: TextItem
  text: Replace the cap.
- type: TextItem
  text: '127'

page_number: 128
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Add oil
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Connectors
- type: TextItem
  text: The following parts only function well if they are provided with sufficient
    oil. Check this regularly.
- type: TextItem
  text: The connectors between the central gearbox and the spreading disc gearboxes
    are used with border spreading and when checking the spreading pattern with the
    tray test. Disconnect one of the connectors from the spreading discs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Apply a suitable lubricant to the drive axles and connectors. Oiling the
    connectors will prevent them from corroding and becoming
- type: TextItem
  text: difficult to use.
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '128'
