page_number: 131
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Checking the hydraulic system
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Replacement intervals
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Hydraulic oil is under high pressure
- type: TextItem
  text: Never try to stop a leak with your fingers. Never try to locate a hydraulic
    leak or try to contain it by hand! When inspecting always use appropriate aid
    (e.g. a piece of wood or sheet metal) and wear safety goggles, safety gloves and
    gloves! High pressure fluid easily penetrates skin and clothes, causing severe
    injuries. In the event of injury, contact your physician immediately!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Do not exceed the maximum hydraulic pressure of 210 bars
- type: TextItem
  text: Prevent the pressure in the hydraulic system from exceeding 210 bars! Working
    above the permitted pressure may damage your machine and result in dangerous situations.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Keep your distance from the hydraulics during inspecting and test running
- type: TextItem
  text: Use a stick to bend the hydraulic hoses when checking them for leakage. That
    way you will keep at sufficient distance. Oil jets or hoses that snap back may
    cause serious physical injury due to the prevailing pressure and temperature.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Work safely on the hydraulic system
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The hydraulic system could be under high pressure. Do not work on the hydraulic
    system without:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · releasing the pressure from the hydraulic system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching the tractor off,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the key must be removed from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · using the proper tools,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear safety glasses, gloves and shoes.
- type: TextItem
  text: Working in an unsafe manner on the hydraulic system could lead to injury and
    damage to the machine. In the event of injury, contact your physician immediately!
    There is also the risk of infection!
- type: TextItem
  text: Before operating the hydraulic system, check all connections and hoses for
    damage and leakage.
- type: TextItem
  text: Regularly inspect the hydraulic system (hoses, pipes, connections). All hoses,
    piping and connecting points must be checked regularly, but at least once a year,
    by an expert for leakages or visible damage! The lifetime of a hose should be
    6 years maximum (see the production date on the hoses).
- type: TextItem
  text: Damaged or old parts must be replaced with new ones that comply with the technical
    specifications of the manufacturer of the machine. Damage to the hydraulic system
    could lead to injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: '131'

page_number: 132
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Inspection criteria
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Replacing instructions
- type: TextItem
  text: '132'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'It is not permitted to carry out repairs on hydraulic hoses! Replace hoses
    if the following is detected during inspection:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · damage to the exterior up to the armouring (such as abrasion marks, cuts
    and tears),
- type: ListItem
  text: · the exterior becoming brittle (tears in the hose),
- type: ListItem
  text: · distortion not normal for the pattern of the hose while under pressure,
    as well as without pressure or with bends, e.g. layers pealing off and blisters
    forming,
- type: ListItem
  text: · leakages,
- type: ListItem
  text: · not mounted as per requirements,
- type: ListItem
  text: · damage or distortion of the hose block, which would compromise the strength
    of the block or the connection between the hose and the regulating block,
- type: ListItem
  text: · hose coming out of the connectors,
- type: ListItem
  text: · corrosion of the connector which would compromise the function and strength,
- type: ListItem
  text: · exceeding the storage and the operating limits.
- type: TextItem
  text: Only use original parts when replacing hoses. Hoses must be placed and mounted
    in the proper way. Be careful not to change the connections. Replaced hoses must
    be suitable to the permitted work pressure and be resistant to chemical, mechanical
    and thermal loads. Only use hose clamps made from stainless steel.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Run the hydraulic control valves until all the cylinders are engaged.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on the ground or on firm supports on a firm, level ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Take the pressure off the hydraulic system.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off, remove the key
    from the ignition and engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Disengage the machine.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Disconnecting the machine« on page 119.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Demount the connectors with the proper tools.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Collect the oil that drips from the cylinders and the hoses.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Mount new hoses and put them so that they would not get pinched.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Dispose of the collected oil as required by national legislation.
- type: TextItem
  text: Operate the hydraulic control valves of the tractor very carefully at first
    after replacing the hoses as there could still be pockets of air in the pipes!
    Open and close all the hydraulic control valves a few times before you start working.

page_number: 133
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Checking and setting the dosing mechanism
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material
    you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear
    protective clothing and safety gloves, read the safety instructions provided by
    the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause
    physical harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting and checking the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Work safely while checking and adjusting:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you start with
    the adjustments,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Check the settings of the dosing mechanism:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · after the first 10 running hours,
- type: ListItem
  text: · for each season,
- type: ListItem
  text: · after every 100 operational hours,
- type: ListItem
  text: · if the spreading pattern between the left and right spreading discs differs
    more than 3%.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Test the left and right spreading patterns« on page 78.
- type: TextItem
  text: '133'

page_number: 134
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Set the position of the dosing mechanism
- type: TextItem
  text: The dosing mechanism must be mounted exactly in the middle above the spreading
    discs. The agitator axle must turn freely from the seal ring.
- type: TextItem
  text: agitator axle
- type: PictureItem
  caption: agitator axle
- type: TextItem
  text: Seal ring
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Seal ring
- type: TextItem
  text: Dashboard
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Dashboard
- type: TextItem
  text: fastening bolt
- type: PictureItem
  caption: fastening bolt
- type: TextItem
  text: '134'
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: TextItem
  text: If you open the filters, you should block them to prevent unwanted closing.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on the ground or on firm supports on a firm, level ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off, remove the key
    from the ignition and engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the sieves with the included attachment and deposit it.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the agitator from the agitator axle.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if the distance between the agitator axle and the seal ring is the
    same on all sides.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the distance is not equal all over the position of the dosing plate can
    be changed with regards to the agitator axle.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the dashboard by loosening the 3 fixing knobs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the nuts on the 4 fastening bolts with which the dosing mechanism is
    attached to the hopper a few times to loosen them.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Move the dosing plate so that the distance between the agitator axle and
    the seal ring is the same on all sides.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Fasten the nuts on the 4 fastening bolts again without moving the dosing
    plates again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Put the agitator back on.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Reattach the dashboard with the three fixing knobs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the connections as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Checking and setting the discharge point setting mechanism« on
    page 136.

page_number: 135
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Setting the dosing baffles
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Fixing slot
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: TextItem
  text: It is necessary to set the dosing plates to the correct positions to each
    other to ensure correct dosing. If the dosing openings do not close well you will
    loose unnecessary fertiliser and the application rate will be higher than intended
    with a specific dosing setting. If the baffles slide far over each other the application
    rate will be much lower than expected.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the dosing plates are mounted in the correct positions, you will see a
    small crack of light when the dosing openings are closed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Close the spreader dosing units on the control box. The actuators must be
    closed properly.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on the ground or on firm supports on a firm, level ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off, remove the key
    from the ignition and engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the sieves with the included attachment and deposit it.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if you can see a small crack between the dosing baffles.
- type: ListItem
  text:  If not, move the actuator attachment point on the dosing mechanism until
    a small chink is visible between the dosing plates.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and open and close the dosing units by operating the start
    and stop keys a few times.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off and remove the
    keys from the ignition.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check if you can see a small crack between the dosing baffles.
- type: TextItem
  text: '135'

- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material
    you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear
    protective clothing and safety gloves, read the safety instructions provided by
    the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause
    physical harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting and checking the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Work safely while checking and adjusting:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you start with
    the adjustments,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the form of the spreading pattern is not the same on the left and on the
    right and the difference in the application rate is more than 3% it could be caused
    by a difference in position of the discharge point with regards to the spreading
    disc between the left and right sides. The distance between the inside of the
    rope and the opening of the discharge bushing must be 109 mm .
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on the ground or on firm supports on a firm, level ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the first checks as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Checking and setting the dosing mechanism« on page 133.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off, remove the key
    from the ignition and engage the parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Specify the discharge position Q on the terminal.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Press successively start and stop spreading to activate the correct position.

items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: ListItem
  text:  Attach the rope as per the illustration.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Measure the distance between the inside of the rope and the opening of the
    discharge bushing carefully.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the measured distance is more or less than 109 mm, do the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Loosen the 2 bolts of the actuator plate slightly.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Slide the actuator plate until the distance between the inside of the rope
    and the opening of the discharge bushing is 109 mm.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Re-fasten the 2 bolts without sliding the actuator plate again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the check on the other side as well.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Secure the dashboard by fastening the 3 fixing knobs.

  text: '138'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material
    you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear
    protective clothing and safety gloves, read the safety instructions provided by
    the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause
    physical harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting and checking the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Work safely while checking and adjusting:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you start with
    the adjustments,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: The distance between the discharge bushing and the spreading disc must be
    1.0 mm .
- type: TextItem
  text: If the distance is too great, the fertiliser does not flow through the discharge
    point opening onto the spreading disc but onto a random point below the discharge
    bushing. This results in a disrupted spreading pattern.
- type: TextItem
  text: If the distance is too short, a full hopper may rest partly on the spreading
    disc, which seriously damages the machine as a result.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Attach the empty machine and raise it to working height (75 cm).
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place heavy, stable supports under the ends of the lifting arms.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the arms onto the supports. Now the machine cannot drop accidentally.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the tractor off, remove the key from the ignition and engage the
    parking brake of the tractor.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Measure the distance between the spreading disc and the discharge bushing.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can use a feeler gauge to measure short distances accurately.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'If the measured distance is more or less than 1.0 mm, do the following:'
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the dashboard by loosening the 3 fixing knobs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the lock nuts on the 4 fastening bolts with which the dosing mechanism
    is attached to the hopper a few times to loosen them.

page_number: 139
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: INDICATION
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Bayonet ring
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn the nuts on the 4 fastening bolts so that the dosing mechanism moves
    upward.
- type: TextItem
  text: The dosing mechanism is now higher than the spreading disc and discharge bushing.
    Turn the dosing mechanism upwards until you have good access to the bolts attaching
    the discharge bushing to the agitator axle star.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Unscrew the bolts attaching the discharge bush to the star a few times.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Move the discharge bushing upwards or downwards until the distance to the
    spreading disc is 1.0 mm.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can also put 1.0 mm thick plates between the discharge bush and the spreading
    disc and lower the discharge bush onto them.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn on the bolts attaching the discharge bushing to the agitator axle star.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the height again and adjust it if necessary.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Lower the dosing mechanism by turning the fastening bolt nuts upward.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Lower the dosing mechanism until the bayonet ring has moved halfway across
    the bolts attaching the discharge bushing to the star.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check the position of the dosing mechanism relative to the agitator axle.
    The distance between the agitator axle and the sealing ring must be the same on
    all sides.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See paragraph »Checking and setting the dosing mechanism« on page 133.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Turn on the lock nuts on 4 fastening bolts without moving the dosing mechanism
    again.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Check that the agitator is not in contact with the bolts attaching the agitator
    seal ring.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Reattach the dashboard with the three fixing knobs.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Perform the check on the other side as well.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Finally, check the position of the dosing mechanism and the position of
    the dosing baffle as described in
- type: ListItem
  text:  paragraph »Checking and setting the dosing mechanism« on page 133.
- type: TextItem
  text: '139'

items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Maintenance
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Replacing agitator axle seal
- type: TextItem
  text: '140'
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Avoid contact with the fertiliser and other material
- type: TextItem
  text: You will most likely get into contact with the fertiliser and other material
    you may wish to spread while filling, adjusting and testing the spreader. Wear
    protective clothing and safety gloves, read the safety instructions provided by
    the supplier and follow their directions. Contact with these materials could cause
    physical harm.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Be careful that nothing gets jammed
- type: TextItem
  text: It is easy for parts to get jammed while adjusting and checking the spreader.
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Work safely while checking and adjusting:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · switching off the electronic control system,
- type: ListItem
  text: · switch the tractor off and remove the key from the ignition,
- type: ListItem
  text: · engage the parking brake of the tractor,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wait for all machine parts to come to a standstill before you start with
    the adjustments,
- type: ListItem
  text: · wear protective clothing, such as safety gloves and shoes,
- type: ListItem
  text: · carefully follow the instructions given.
- type: TextItem
  text: Friction with these materials could cause physical injury.
- type: TextItem
  text: The agitator axle is equipped with a plastic seal to prevent fertiliser granule
    loss along the agitator axle. The seal must be replaced every season, as well
    as after every 100 operational hours. Only work on a clean machine with an empty
    hopper.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Set the fine application handle to the normal dosing setting.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Start the tractor and engage the control box.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Activate the empty hopper function.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Please refer to the software instruction manual
- type: ListItem
  text:  Wait until both actuators are completely extended and the dosing units are
    completely open.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Place the machine on the ground or on firm supports on a firm, level ground.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Switch the electronic control system and the tractor off, remove the key
    from the ignition and engage the parking brake of the tractor.

  text: Maintenance
- type: ListItem
  text:  Open the sieves with the included attachment and deposit it.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Remove the agitator from the agitator axle.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Support the fertiliser bearing ring through a dosing opening so that it

  text: Check the connections as described in

- type: TextItem
  text: Accessories
- type: TextItem
  text: Accessories
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: General
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch control box
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: '142'
- type: TextItem
  text: The following accessories for your machine are available to adapt it to your
    tractor and/or are working conditions.
- type: TextItem
  text: All of the responsibilities of the manufacturer lapse and the guarantee becomes
    null and void if non-genuine parts are used.
- type: TextItem
  text: For complete ISO control, the IsoMatch control box offers many extra new functions.
- type: TextItem
  text: The latest developments in the field of ISOBUS steering, coupling of the tractor
    and machine and ease-of-use are all incorporated in the IsoMatch.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Many functions and programmes on one control box
- type: TextItem
  text: 'The divided screen has a flexible division to:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · operate 2 programmes or functions simultaneously on screen, e.g. the spreader
    and a separate operating programme. This can be done without having to switch.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Instruction booklet in the correct language on screen.
- type: ListItem
  text: '· Check the following by camera in the cabin while working:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · a specific point on the machine,
- type: ListItem
  text: · the crop
- type: ListItem
  text: · or the vicinity.
- type: ListItem
  text: '· Extra functions:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Calculator
- type: ListItem
  text: · Internet browser
- type: ListItem
  text: · Camera screen (Camera is optional)
- type: ListItem
  text: · Status bar for time, GPS signal strength and driving direction (with GEOCONTROL
    extension to the IsoMatch)
- type: ListItem
  text: '· Save:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · Documents
- type: ListItem
  text: · Tractor data
- type: ListItem
  text: · Field particulars
- type: ListItem
  text: · Work particulars of various ISO machines.
- type: ListItem
  text: · Client particulars.

page_number: 143
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch Tellus GO control box
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: ISOBUS tractor connection
- type: TextItem
  text: Input IM Tellus with ISO11786 In cab connection
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Input IM Tellus with ISO11786 In cab connection
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Conversion to non-ISO tractor with IsoMatch power
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Accessories
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Compact and complete
- type: TextItem
  text: IsoMatch Go, as a handy and more compact variant of the doublescreen version,
    offers complete ISO control with all functions. Besides the smaller dimension
    with the single screen, the number of USB connections and the absence of Wlan/Wifi
    constitutes the biggest difference.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Many additional functions.
- type: TextItem
  text: The latest developments in ISOBUS communication between tractor and implement
    and ease-of-use are all incorporated into the IsoMatch Tellus GO.
- type: TextItem
  text: A scroll wheel on the upper right of the box and an additional keyboard make
    menu navigation easy.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Connect the ISOBUS tractor via IM Tellus 9-point in Cab cable
- type: TextItem
  text: If your tractor is provided with a full ISOBUS connection, a connection with
    the 9-pins in Cab cable between your tractor and the IsoMatch Tellus GO control
    box is sufficient.
- type: TextItem
  text: Other connections are made via the "Input IM Tellus" cable, supplied as a
    standard item.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Connect the ISOBUS tractor via IM Tellus 9-point in Cab cable
- type: TextItem
  text: If your tractor is provided with a complete ISOBUS connection, a connection
    with the 9-pins in Cab cable between your tractor and the IsoMatch control box
    is sufficient.
- type: TextItem
  text: Other connections are made via the "Input IM Tellus" cable, supplied as a
    standard item.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Input IM Tellus with ISO11786 In cab connection
- type: TextItem
  text: 'A connection set is supplied as a standard item with the IsoMatch for:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · ISO 11786 In cab
- type: ListItem
  text: · lights and ignition
- type: ListItem
  text: · Tractor CAN (optional plug specific to the tractor required)
- type: ListItem
  text: · Video input.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch power cable set for non-ISO tractors
- type: TextItem
  text: If the tractor does not have an ISOBUS communication, it can be added with
    the IsoMatch power cable set.
- type: TextItem
  text: Hereafter, your tractor is entirely ISOBUS ready, and you can connect and
    operate the machine with the IsoMatch control box.
- type: TextItem
  text: The "Input IM Tellus" cable, supplied as a standard item, can be used for
    other connections.
- type: TextItem
  text: '143'

page_number: 144
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Accessories
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Cable with 7-point plugs for ISO 11786 in cab connection
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IM Tellus sensor input
- type: TextItem
  text: Sensor input IM Tellus with sensor connection Sensor input IM Tellus with
    sensor connection
- type: PictureItem
  caption: Sensor input IM Tellus with sensor connection Sensor input IM Tellus with
    sensor connection
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Extended ISO cable
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: RS232 cable
- type: TextItem
  text: '144'
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Directly to the ISO 11786 in cab tractor connection in the tractor cabin
- type: TextItem
  text: You can mount an optional extension cable to the ISO 11786 in cab tractor
    connection on the 7-point plug "Input IM Tellus" cable supplied as a standard
    item.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Directly to the tractor radar or wheel sensor
- type: TextItem
  text: You can connect the tractor's speed sensor or radar to the IsoMatch control
    box with the optional "Sensor input IM Tellus".
- type: TextItem
  text: This is needed if your tractor does not have the ISO 11786 in cab connection.
    Other connections are the same as the "Input IM Tellus" cable set, supplied as
    a standard item.
- type: TextItem
  text: Various cables and extension cables for many different types of radar are
    available.
- type: ListItem
  text:  Also see the spare parts manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: An extended ISO cable is available for a tractor-trailed spreader. This replaces
    the short cable that is already fitted. Exchange the whole cable.
- type: ListItem
  text:  The wire-connecting diagram is displayed in the spare parts manual.
- type: TextItem
  text: The Tellus control box communicates with an external system via an RS 232
    connection. You can use a cable with an RS232 plug to connect the signal from
    an external system to the Tellus control box. You can find the plug pin occupation
    in
- type: ListItem
  text:  The Tellus control box operating manual.

page_number: 145
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Spreader control software
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: GEOCONTROL software
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: IsoMatch Grip
- type: PictureItem
  caption: ''
- type: TextItem
  text: Accessories
- type: TextItem
  text: A user licence can be purchased via the IsoMatch shop which, after the expiry
    of the free test period, allows your machine to work with
- type: ListItem
  text: · Task controller
- type: ListItem
  text: · external application rate
- type: ListItem
  text: · control for headland management and GEOSPREAD functions.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com
- type: TextItem
  text: IsoMatch GEOCONTROL is an advanced software application for more precise and
    efficient use of fertiliser spreaders.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Site-dependent control of your GEOSPREADER
- type: TextItem
  text: Around the spreader
- type: ListItem
  text: · to get spreading done specific to the site
- type: ListItem
  text: · with automatic headland control
- type: ListItem
  text: · and working width reduction with gored spreading,
- type: TextItem
  text: you require additional software. See the website www.isomatchshop.com
- type: TextItem
  text: The IsoMatch Grip is a control unit on which most of the machine functions
    used can be operated centrally with one handle. This is available in addition
    to the ISO tractor or ISOMatch control box.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Handle control
- type: TextItem
  text: While working attention and visibility is often required to follow the work
    process. If operating buttons can be located by the sense of touch  reaction  speed  can  be  increased  and  operating  mistakes
    avoided. By locating the control buttons on the handle by touch while you are
    looking where you are driving system control can remain focussed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com .
- type: TextItem
  text: '145'

- type: TextItem
  text: To complement the GEOCONTROL functions an optically guided steering
- type: TextItem
  text: instrument will assist you in finding and keeping the A-B line during various
    activities.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: DGPS driven steering
- type: TextItem
  text: The upper and middle section shows the DGPS driven steering while spraying
    and for other treatments, where close monitoring of the pass is required.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: GEOCONTROL Section Activity
- type: TextItem
  text: At the bottom of the display you will see the enabled and disabled sections
    displayed.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com
- type: TextItem
  text: The latest development in ISOBUS communication is an extension to the IsoMatch
    terminal for tractors which cannot give any own locational information. The GPS
    antenna with DGPS accuracy allows satellite navigation for field-specific section
    control, variable dosing and field registration.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com
- type: TextItem
  text: Connection with local Wireless Internet and IsoMatch. With IsoMatch Wireless,
    you can easily connect the IsoMatch Tellus (GO) to any wireless network. Think
    of hot spot, home network, etc.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com
- type: TextItem
  text: IsoMatch Eye is an accessory for better visibility, day and night. The camera
    can be connected to the IsoMatch Tellus and IsoMatch Tellus GO terminal.
- type: ListItem
  text:  See the website www.isomatchshop.com

- type: TextItem
  text: Troubleshooting
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Trouble-shooting table
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    Problem:
      0: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      1: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      2: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      3: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)

      9: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      10: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      11: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      12: Incorrect appli- cation rates  (kg per hec- tare)
      13: Difference be- tween the flow- rate on the left  and the right  spreading  discs
      14: Difference be- tween the flow- rate on the left  and the right  spreading  discs
      15: Difference be- tween the flow- rate on the left  and the right  spreading  discs
    Possible cause:
      0: Dosing setting incorrectly set
      1: Incorrect setting for fine dosage
      2: Driving speed signal not correctly set
      3: Incorrect driving speed signal
      4: Incorrect distance between the driving  tracks
      5: New type of fertiliser spread with the  same settings as the previous type.
        Qual- ity varies greatly between types.
      6: The flow of the fertiliser is blocked
      7: Dosing setting and flowrate not entered  on the 'Curve Calibration' screen
        before  starting work activities
      8: Incorrect application rate, working width  and/or letter value discharge
        point en- tered
      9: The control system is being operated  manually, so it does not perform automat-
        ic calibration
      10: Incorrect values entered after a manual  calibration test at a manually
        entered ap- plication rate
      11: The speedometer is incorrect or not  measuring
      12: 'For a tractor without driving speed meas- urement: the simulated and real
        driving  speeds do not correspond'
      13: Actuators set unequally
      14: The stop of one or both of the actuators  have been moved
      15: Discharge is blocked on the one side
    Solution:
      0: Check the dosing setting
      1: Set the dosing setting for fine application  as per the instructions
      2: Set the correct source of the driving speed  signal in the control system,
        as well as the  control box
      3: Calibrate the driving speed
      4: Always set the driving tracks before  spreading
      5: Determine the characteristics of the fertil- iser, look for the relevant
        spreading chart  and set the spreader again
      6: Clean the machine well after each use. Replace the agitator if it is worn
        out
      7: Find the correct values in the spreading  chart and enter them
      8: Enter the correct values in the control sys- tem
      9: Switch to automatic operation
      10: Perform the calibration test in the correct  manner and enter the result
        obtained
      11: Check the sensors and cables and cali- brate the wheel sensor or radar
      12: Adjust the simulated driving speed on the  main screen or the real driving
        speed
      13: Check the settings
      14: Check the position of the connecting  points and readjust them
      15: Clean the machine well after each use. Replace the agitator if it is worn
        out

page_number: 153
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Troubleshooting
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    Problem:
      0: Great amounts  of dust while  spreading
      1: Great amounts  of dust while  spreading
      2: Great amounts  of dust while  spreading
      3: Great amounts  of dust while  spreading
      4: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      5: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      6: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      7: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      8: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      9: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      10: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      11: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      12: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      13: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      14: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      15: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
      16: Spreading  tracks visible  among the  crops
    Possible cause:
      0: Average quality fertiliser (too soft, broken,  mixed types) or incorrect
        storage
      1: Rpm on the spreading discs too high
      2: agitator grinds. Dosing units closed for too  long with the PTO shaft running
      3: Right agitator grinds
      4: Average quality fertiliser. 80% of the gran- ules with a diameter between
        2.0 - 4.75  mm
      5: Blend of fertiliser types used. A blend can  become unmixed again or types
        of fertil- iser could contain varying spreading qual- ities
      6: New type of fertiliser spread with the  same settings as the previous type.
        Qual- ity varies greatly between types.
      7: Use of wrong spreading chart
      8: 'Working with unfavourable weather con- ditions: high levels of humidity,
        rain, heat  or high wind speeds (> 5 m/sec)'
      9: Incorrect overlapping of the spreading  pattern
      10: Horizontal/vertical settings of the machine  not correct
      11: Spreader not set to the correct height
      12: Working width incorrect
      13: Worn or missing vanes
      14: Tyre pressure on the left and right not the  same
      15: The setting mechanism of the discharge  point is not set well
      16: The dosing mechanism is not set well
    Solution:
      0: Contact your supplier. Update the storage area. Spread with smaller working
        widths as far  as possible
      1: Check the PTO shaft speed and the cou- pling shaft mounting point
      2: Switch the PTO shaft off after closing the  dosing units. Check the agitator
        for damage
      3: Spreading disc not disconnected while  border spreading with the border spread-
        ing plate
      4: Determine the distribution and spread  with small working widths if possible
      5: Check the type, pattern and distribution. Spread with smaller working widths
        as far  as possible
      6: Determine the characteristics of the fertil- iser, look for the relevant
        spreading chart  and set the spreader again
      7: Determine the characteristics of the fertil- iser and select the correct
        spreading chart
      8: Only work under good weather conditions
      9: Always set the driving tracks before  spreading
      10: Check if the machine is standing level  horizontally and vertically.
      11: Check and set to the correct working  height (75 cm above the crops or soil)
      12: Check the discharge point letter and the  PTO shaft RPM
      13: Check the vanes
      14: Check the tyre pressure
      15: Perform the »Checking and setting the  discharge point setting mechanism«
      16: Perform the »Checking and setting the  dosing mechanism«
    Pag e:

      4: 59,  64

page_number: 154
items:
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Troubleshooting
- type: TableItem
  table_data:
    Problem:
      0: Machine  makes a noise  while running
      1: Machine  makes a noise  while running
      2: Machine  makes a noise  while running
      3: Machine  makes a noise  while running
      4: Powerful vibra- tions percepti- ble
      5: Powerful vibra- tions percepti- ble
      6: Powerful vibra- tions percepti- ble
      7: Powerful vibra- tions percepti- ble
      8: Alarm on the  control box  screen
      9: The external  system is not  communicat- ing with the  control box
      10: The external  system is not  communicat- ing with the  control box
      11: The external  system is not  communicat- ing with the  control box
      12: The external  system is not  communicat- ing with the  control box
      13: Spreader does  not appear on  the screen
      14: Spreader does  not appear on  the screen
      15: Spreader does  not appear on  the screen
    Possible cause:
      0: Discharge bushing makes contact with  the spreading disc
      1: Spreader put down with filled hopper
      2: Spreading disc hidden/ out of balance
      3: Build-up of fertiliser at the agitator and/or  spreading discs
      4: Shut down the PTO shaft immediately!
      5: Great imbalance in the spreading discs
      6: Bent agitator axle or damaged agitator
      7: PTO shaft working angle out of working  reach
      8: The control system cannot perform re- quested function correctly
      9: RS232 plug does not have the correct  connection on the side of the control
        box  for the signal from the external system
      10: The control box and external systems are  not communicating with each other
        in the  same language
      11: Application rate control by means of an  external signal is not connected
      12: External system not switched on or incor- rectly set
      13: Control box displays another system
      14: Spreader ISO plug not connected
      15: Power supply to the spreader and/or con- trol box interrupted
    Solution:
      0: Please contact your dealer
      1: Repair the machine.  Set dosing mechanism and discharge  point again
      2: Check the spreading discs for damage  and for the presence of all the vanes
      3: Remove the fertiliser. Clean the machine well after each use.
      4: Attend to the problem to prevent damage
      5: Check the vanes and spreading discs
      6: Replace the agitator axle or the agitator
      7: Limit the working angle to a maximum of  30º
      8: Consult meaning and advice in the soft- ware instruction manual.
      9: Check and modify the plug pin occupation  on the side of the control box,

page_number: 155
items:
- type: TextItem
  text: Falling into disuse
- type: TextItem
  text: Falling into disuse
- type: TextItem
  text: When the lifespan of the machine has finished, its separate parts must be
    properly disposed of. Keep local legislation in mind with this!
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Metal parts
- type: TextItem
  text: You must deliver all metal parts to a metal recycling company.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Plastic parts
- type: TextItem
  text: All plastic parts can be disposed of as unwanted garbage.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Oil and grease
- type: TextItem
  text: You must send oil and grease to a processing company for used oil and grease.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Rubber
- type: TextItem
  text: Rubber parts such as tyres and hoses must be disposed of at a rubber processing
    company.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Electronic waste
- type: TextItem
  text: Electronic waste, such as the electronic control box and the machine boxes,
    must be disposed of at specialist companies.
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Fertiliser
- type: TextItem
  text: Remaining fertiliser must be stored or disposed of in accordance with the
    regulations for chemicals.
- type: TextItem
  text: '155'

  text: Liability
- type: TextItem
  text: Liability
- type: SectionHeaderItem
  text: Liability
- type: TextItem
  text: '156'
- type: TextItem
  text: 'Without prejudice to the other stipulations of these General Conditions and
    the stipulations of the act on product responsibility, the seller is only responsible
    for damage caused by culpable breach of contract and by unlawful actions in the
    framework of the regulations below:'
- type: ListItem
  text: 1. He/she is completely responsible for damage that result from gross neglect
    due to his/her own actions or due to gross negligence of his/ her legal representatives
    or supervising employees.
- type: ListItem
  text: 2. He/she can be held responsible for not abiding to the main contractual
    requirements and to the other requirements of the contract insofar as that is
    of vital importance for the purpose of the agreement (cardinal requirements) in
    principle, through each of his/her own culpable acts or through each culpable
    act of his/her legal representatives or those under his/her supervision, insofar
    as responsibility is not already indicated under point 1.
- type: ListItem
  text: 3. The seller is also responsible for intentional and gross neglect caused
    by him/her or by someone under his/her supervision for so far as responsibility
    has not been determined under point 1 yet. Liability for his/her own neglect in
    terms of simple neglect by his/her legal representatives or on his behalf by people
    under his/her supervision excluded, will the requirements of point 2 remain valid.
- type: ListItem
  text: 4. Insofar as there is liability in terms of points 2 and 3, the extent thereof
    is limited to normal remuneration for damage incurred.
- type: ListItem
  text: 5. The above regulations under 1 to 4 can be applied to any liability with
    the conclusion of the agreement. These stipulations are limited with retroactive
    effect to damages based on this legal title.

- type: TextItem
  text: Liability
- type: PictureItem

- type: TextItem
  text: 'The following stipulations apply, along with national legislation:'
- type: ListItem
  text: · The buyer must check the equipment, accessories and spare parts upon delivery
    for transport damage and completeness. Any possible shortcomings must be reported
    without delay.
- type: ListItem
  text: · The seller will only consider complaints if the buyer reports that in writing
    within fourteen days after delivery by the seller.
- type: ListItem
  text: · The buyer must report hidden damage as soon as it becomes visible, but no
    later than six months after delivery of the equipment. The legal period of limitation
    remains valid.
- type: TextItem
  text: You can obtain the applicable guarantee conditions for your machine from your
    dealer. He is also responsible for the first settlement of guarantee cases.
